title: Prolactin: The Hidden Hormone Killing Your Erections In 2025
content:
Today, you’re going to discover how you can have an easier time getting erections and orgasms more often by manipulating one hormone.

And no, it’s not testosterone, estrogen, or even cortisol.

In fact, optimizing this one hormone will increase your testosterone and dopamine levels at the same time, while also improving your mood and sex drive.

I’ll also reveal how you can do this naturally with food, lifestyle, and supplements – or with two specific drugs, both of which I’ve personally used.

Either way, you’ll have clear choices and real solutions.

A Subscriber’s Blood Test Wake-Up Call

A subscriber recently asked me a question after running a detailed hormone blood test on his own.

His prolactin came back elevated at 34 ng/mL, while his testosterone was in the low-middle range at 461 ng/mL.

He explained that his sex drive was lower, erections were harder to maintain, and orgasms were more difficult to achieve.

He also mentioned puffy nipples, low motivation, and a flat mood — all classic signs of elevated prolactin.

So let’s break this down.

Prolactin is a hormone produced by the pituitary gland. In women, it stimulates breast milk production.

In men, prolactin should remain low and helps regulate testosterone, dopamine, and reproductive function.

When prolactin rises too high, problems begin.

Elevated prolactin is linked to:

Lower testosterone levels

Lower dopamine levels

Longer refractory periods

Reduced libido and erectile dysfunction

Gynecomastia (man boobs)

Low motivation and mood issues

This is why lowering elevated prolactin often results in better erections, stronger orgasms, and higher sex drive.

Why Prolactin Kills Erections

Prolactin is inversely related to dopamine.

When dopamine is high, prolactin is low. When prolactin rises, dopamine falls.

During sexual arousal, dopamine increases. After orgasm, prolactin spikes and dopamine drops.

When prolactin stays chronically elevated, this suppresses testosterone, dopamine, and sexual responsiveness.

That’s why high prolactin leads to longer refractory periods – meaning it takes much longer to get another erection or orgasm.

Symptoms of High Prolactin in Men

Infertility or low sperm count

Vision issues (in severe cases)

A blood test is always the best way to confirm elevated prolactin.

Main Causes of High Prolactin

In extreme cases (over 250 ng/mL), the cause is often a benign pituitary tumor.

However, most men experience elevated prolactin from much more common causes.

Antidepressants and antipsychotics

Blood pressure medications

Opiates and pain medications

Acid reflux medications

Antihistamines and anticonvulsants

Anabolic steroids (especially 19-nor compounds)

Chronic stress (high cortisol)

Excessive high-intensity training

Excessive nipple stimulation

How to Lower Prolactin Naturally

Managing stress and improving sleep are the most important lifestyle factors.

Chronic cortisol elevation directly raises prolactin.

Moderate exercise is helpful, but overtraining increases prolactin through cortisol and adrenaline.

Supplements That Actually Work

P5P (Activated Vitamin B6) Supports dopamine production and helps suppress prolactin. 50 mg daily is more than enough.

Zinc + Copper 15–30 mg zinc with the proper copper ratio lowers prolactin, estrogen, and DHT.

Velvet Bean Extract (25% L-DOPA) Direct dopamine precursor. 100 mg daily is effective. Max dose: 200 mg.

These ingredients are found together in AlphaViril, which is why I’ve used it for over 25 years.

Prescription Options (Use Sparingly)

Disclaimer: Always speak to your doctor before using medications.

Cabergoline (Dostinex)

This dopamine agonist directly shuts down prolactin production.

A very low dose — 0.25 mg once per week – can dramatically lower prolactin.

However, higher or frequent dosing is associated with heart valve damage.

This should only be used occasionally, not regularly.

Bromocriptine (Parlodel)

Less powerful than cabergoline, with a shorter half-life.

It must be taken more frequently and causes more side effects.

Low doses (0.625–1.25 mg) can still be effective.

High prolactin quietly destroys erections, libido, testosterone, and motivation.

The solution starts with lowering stress and cortisol, improving sleep, and supporting dopamine.

For supplements, P5P, zinc + copper, and velvet bean extract are usually more than enough.

Prescription drugs should only be a last resort and used sparingly.

Fix prolactin, and you’ll naturally improve testosterone, dopamine, erections, orgasms, mood, and confidence.

Important "Testosterone & Libido Boosting" Shortcut

I think we can all agree that boosting testosterone levels and having a healthy hormone profile is very important (muscles, sexual performance, fat loss, brain health, etc.)

Unfortunately, most of us don't have the time, money or devotion to make big lifestyle changes (diet, exercise, stress management, etc.)

Well, the good news is that now you can quickly achieve your "testosterone boosting" goals with ONE simple solution that's easy, convenient & requires NO lifestyle changes...

title: Penis Size: This Body Part Secretly Predicts It - 2025 Study
content:
What part of the body predicts penis size best?

According to a [current_size] study, it’s not height, hand size, or foot length — it’s actually the nose.

Surprised? You’re not alone.

Today, you’ll learn about this surprising discovery and more importantly, how you can actually increase penis size and hardness at any age.

We’ll also break down the role of testosterone and DHT, what causes penis shrinkage, and how to reverse it naturally – even in adulthood.

Does Body Size Really Predict Penis Size?

Women often comment on my large hands and feet — and assume I must be well-endowed.

While I’m taller than average and above average in size, that assumption can create unrealistic expectations.

Let’s be honest, 10 inches is not normal — or common.

Still, the myth persists.

Most people believe that taller men or those with bigger feet and hands must also have a bigger penis.

But is this really true?

What Science Actually Says

Researchers in Japan examined 136 deceased men between the ages of 30 and 50.

All measurements were taken within three days of their passing to ensure accuracy.

They recorded flaccid and stretched penile length, as well as testicle size, prostate weight, and several other body features. In urology, stretched penile length is commonly used to estimate erect size.

The Unexpected Finding

Height, weight, hand size, and foot size had zero correlation with penis size.

Nose length was the only trait linked to penile length — not girth.

The longer the nose, the longer the penis – statistically speaking.

This study shows that penis size is largely determined before birth.

So yes, genetics and prenatal hormone exposure play a major role.

But does that mean you’re stuck with whatever size you were born with?

Not quite. While you can’t change your genes, you can absolutely influence your hormones and penile tissue growth as an adult.

Hormones That Control Penis Size

Two hormones are primarily responsible for penis development:

Testosterone — critical during puberty for growth

DHT (Dihydrotestosterone) — much stronger, crucial during fetal development

During pregnancy, if the mother doesn’t produce enough hCG, the fetus can’t produce enough testosterone.

This often results in a smaller penis.

Additionally, exposure to toxins such as pesticides or phthalates can lower fetal hormone levels, which may also impact development.

Low androgens in the first trimester can result in ambiguous genitalia.

Later in pregnancy, it may cause a condition known as micropenis.

What About Men Without DHT?

In the Dominican Republic, some men are born without the 5-alpha reductase enzyme.

This means their bodies can’t convert testosterone to DHT.

Have underdeveloped genitals, despite normal testosterone levels

This genetic trait inspired the creation of drugs like Finasteride, which reduce DHT to prevent hair loss and prostate growth — but can also shrink the penis or reduce libido.

How It Works Across Life Stages

DHT is essential for early penis formation.

Testosterone must be present, but it’s the conversion to DHT that triggers proper development.

Testosterone levels surge, causing rapid penis growth.

DHT still plays a role, but it is less directly related to size.

Simply put, you need both hormones, but at different life stages.

DHT dominates during fetal growth. Testosterone takes over during puberty.

Can Adults Grow Their Penis?

Yes, but not through gimmicks.

Here’s the proven formula:

Stimulate tissue with penis-specific exercises

Increase testosterone levels

Think of it like muscle growth: exercise is the stimulus, and testosterone is the fuel.

The same applies here. The higher your testosterone, the more responsive the tissue.

Bonus: My Free Email Series

If you’re serious about growth, I created a free step-by-step email series.

Over 57,000 men have already followed it.

Daily routines and exercises

Hormone-boosting tips

Advice on erection quality and frequency

You’ll also learn how to improve DHT sensitivity – without side effects.

Pro tip: Don’t underestimate your hormone health. Start fixing that first, optimize your testosterone levels, and your results will multiply.

If you’re interested, get my penis enlargement guide now – it’s totally free.

title: Does Semen Retention Boost Testosterone? 2025 Guide
content:
“How much does semen retention increase testosterone levels? I heard it can more than double it.”

This is a hot topic across social media.

TikTok, YouTube, and Reddit are full of claims that semen retention boosts testosterone by 145% or more.

But what does the science say?

What Is Semen Retention?

Semen retention is when you avoid ejaculation, either by not having sex or masturbation or by stopping before climax.

It’s also known as “NoFap.”

Where Did the 145% Claim Come From?

This idea came from a 2003 Chinese study.

It showed a slight testosterone increase on day 7 of abstinence.

However, by day 8, levels returned to normal. There was no lasting benefit.

Despite this, many influencers still push the idea that retention massively increases testosterone – but that’s not what the data shows.

Why Doesn’t Semen Retention Work Long-Term?

Your body likes balance — homeostasis.

Hormones like testosterone are tightly regulated.

The only way to significantly raise it is through external means (like TRT or specific compounds).

What Other Studies Say

More recent research paints a different picture.

For example, a 2021 New York study found that frequent ejaculation was linked to higher testosterone, not less.

Other reviews have found only small hormonal fluctuations in the first few days of abstinence.

And those famous “145% increase” studies? They were either flawed or later retracted.

What Actually Happens After Orgasm?

It’s not testosterone that changes — it’s other hormones like:

Prolactin increases — makes you relaxed, slows recovery

Dopamine drops — temporarily lowers desire

When you’re younger, recovery is fast. As you age, your body takes longer to bounce back.

Is Retention Harmful?

No – but obsessing over it can be.

Stress, guilt, and unhealthy views about sex can hurt your mental and physical health more than a little ejaculation ever will.

So… What Actually Increases Testosterone?

If you want to naturally raise testosterone, focus on:

Lifting weights – 3 – 5x per week. Avoid overtraining, which raises cortisol.

Better sleep – Most hormone production happens during sleep. Aim for deep, consistent rest.

Losing body fat – Less fat = less estrogen = better testosterone balance.

Managing stress – High cortisol destroys testosterone. Reduce toxic inputs, including people, media, and clutter.

Eating clean – Whole eggs, less sugar, and no fried junk. Cholesterol helps make testosterone.

Personal tip: I eat 3–4 whole eggs at night. I’ve noticed better morning erections when I do.

Coincidence? Maybe. But I’ve seen the pattern repeat for years.

Natural supplements help if you’re too busy (or lazy) to optimize everything. That’s why I use AlphaViril – and have for 25 years.

Total & free testosterone

Dopamine support for better libido & mood

It’s clinically backed, works in 30 days or less, and comes with a full money-back guarantee plus $100 bonus if you don’t see results.

Semen retention won’t double your testosterone.

The science simply doesn’t support it.

But if you want to avoid orgasm for other reasons – fine.

Just don’t expect a hormonal miracle.

Instead, focus on what works: smart training, sleep, clean food, less stress, and optional support like AlphaViril.

And yes – enjoy your orgasms.

Trust me, when you’re older, you won’t be having them as often. Enjoy it now while you can.

title: Men: Estrogen Is Quietly Killing Your Testosterone ( 2025)
content:
If you’re concerned about erections, testosterone levels, or if you’re on TRT, taking Clomid, Enclomiphene, HCG, or even herbal testosterone boosters, today’s article is important.

Whether you’re short or fat, bald or hairy, want to fix prostate issues, improve your mood, gain confidence, or get leaner — this topic applies to you.

Today, we’re talking about estrogen. Specifically, how to manage it properly — because if you don’t, it could quietly sabotage all your progress.

Most guys ask me, “My testosterone is fine, but I have low libido or weak erections.” I always follow up with: “What’s your estrogen level?”

Usually, they don’t know. But it matters — a lot.

I’ve personally experienced both high and low estrogen.

Both caused different problems, and neither one felt good.

What Happens When Estrogen Is Too High?

When your estrogen levels are elevated, you might experience:

Erectile dysfunction and low sex drive

Gynecomastia (man boobs)

Water retention and bloating

Mood swings, irritability, and even depression

Prostate problems and higher cancer risk

Estrogen also tells your brain to stop producing testosterone.

That’s why many men feel worse as they age — not because testosterone drops, but because estrogen rises and throws off the balance.

And here’s something you may not realize: fat cells produce estrogen.

So, the fatter you are, the higher your estrogen levels — even without TRT or steroids.

What About Low Estrogen?

On the flip side, too little estrogen is just as bad.

If you crash it with drugs or take the wrong dose of an aromatase inhibitor, you might experience:

Joint pain and dry skin

Low libido and poor erections

Brain fog or feeling emotionally flat

Worsened cholesterol or heart health

Fatigue and poor recovery

So clearly, it’s all about finding the right balance — not just blasting testosterone or blocking estrogen completely.

What Causes High Estrogen in Men?

There are several common causes of elevated estrogen:

Higher body fat (especially belly fat)

Aging (aromatase enzyme increases)

Alcohol and marijuana use

Environmental toxins (plastics, pesticides, etc.)

Chronic stress and poor sleep

And sometimes, it’s genetic.

Some men naturally convert more testosterone into estrogen due to higher aromatase activity.

What About Low Estrogen?

Low estrogen typically results from:

Too much use of estrogen blockers

Extreme fat loss or low body fat

Age-related hormone decline

Certain medications or overtraining

Again, the goal is balance — not elimination.

Prescription Aromatase Inhibitors (AIs)

If you’re using TRT, Clomid, or HCG, you may need a low dose of an AI to manage estrogen.

There are 3 common options:

Arimidex (Anastrozole) – Fast-acting, reversible. Usually 0.25–1mg, 1–3x/week.

Femara (Letrozole) – Very strong. Rarely used due to intensity.

Aromasin (Exemestane) – Irreversible. Longer-lasting. I personally use this.

Note: Too high a dose will crash estrogen. That’s why you should always use the lowest effective dose and test blood levels regularly.

Natural Estrogen Management (No Prescription Needed)

If you want to start naturally — or support TRT with fewer side effects — here are proven supplements:

DIM (Diindolylmethane)

From cruciferous veggies like broccoli. Supports estrogen metabolism.

Recommended dose: 200–300 mg/day

Supports liver detox and estrogen clearance.

Dose: 500–1500 mg/day

Helps boost testosterone and lightly lowers estrogen. Always pair with copper to avoid imbalance.

Velvet Bean Extract (L-Dopa)

Increases dopamine and reduces prolactin — great for sex drive and mood.

Bonus: All of these are included in AlphaViril — which I’ve personally taken for over 25 years.

It supports testosterone, balances estrogen and DHT, and enhances dopamine naturally.

But if you prefer buying ingredients individually, that works too.

Most guys overlook estrogen, but it’s critical — not just for erections and sex drive, but also for muscle, fat loss, mood, prostate health, and even heart health.

Whether you’re using testosterone or not, always test your estradiol levels. Balance is key.

Start with natural support.

If that’s not enough, talk to your doctor about a low dose AI and make sure you monitor all 3: testosterone, estrogen (estradiol), and DHT.

title: Is Apomorphine The Best New ED Drug In 2025 ?
content:
A few months ago, one of my doctor friends told me he was using a new ED drug. He claimed it worked better than Viagra alone.

So, I started doing my own research.

I spoke with others who’ve tried it, reviewed clinical studies, and now I’m here to share the results with you.

This “new” ED drug works differently from common PDE5 inhibitors like Viagra and Cialis.

In fact, HRT clinics are now combining all three into one “super erection pill.”

It’s marketed as the holy grail of erectile dysfunction solutions.

But is that just hype?

Apomorphine is a dopamine agonist — a drug that mimics dopamine when your body isn’t producing enough. It’s gaining attention as an alternative to Viagra and Cialis.

Dopamine is a “feel-good” neurotransmitter.

It drives reward, pleasure, motivation, and yes, sexual desire and arousal.

Actions like sex, porn, gambling, social media, and even food all trigger dopamine spikes. That’s why you crave more of these activities.

Originally Created for Parkinson’s

Apomorphine was originally made to treat Parkinson’s disease, not erectile dysfunction.

Parkinson’s patients suffer from low dopamine and desensitized receptors, causing tremors, muscle control issues, and more.

This drug helps compensate for that loss – and that’s where the ED connection comes in.

How Does Apomorphine Treat Erectile Dysfunction?

Erections are triggered by multiple areas of the brain, neurotransmitters, and hormones.

One of the most important?

Higher dopamine levels enhance sexual arousal, motivation, and erection quality.

Testosterone also plays a big role, increasing both dopamine levels and sensitivity.

Dopamine agonists like Apomorphine bind to D1 and D2 receptors.

This mimics natural dopamine and helps correct sexual dysfunction rooted in low dopamine or low sensitivity.

Apomorphine Forms & Absorption

Apomorphine is available as an injectable or a sublingual tablet that dissolves under the tongue.

Do NOT swallow the pill – it has very low oral bioavailability and gets broken down by the liver before it can work.

FDA Approval & Safety Concerns

It was previously sold under the brand name Uprima for ED, but the manufacturer withdrew the drug in 2000 due to safety issues.

Companies don’t walk away from billion-dollar opportunities unless side effects are a major concern.

Does Apomorphine Work?

Yes — at low doses, it can help improve erections, especially for those with psychological or mild-to-moderate ED.

Research shows that 2 mg taken sublingually takes effect in 15–20 minutes.

That’s faster than most PDE5 inhibitors like Viagra or Cialis — unless you also take those sublingually (a trick I’ve shared before).

Apomorphine may be a good option if you:

Can’t tolerate PDE5 inhibitors (Viagra, Cialis)

Get side effects like headaches, congestion, and a rapid heart rate

Don’t respond well to typical ED meds

Have ED rooted in psychological issues (anxiety, stress, low libido)

However, it’s less effective than Viagra or Cialis for most men — especially if you already have moderate to severe ED.

Don’t Forget Testosterone

Men with higher testosterone respond better to ED meds and require lower doses, which means fewer side effects.

AlphaViril contains natural ingredients to:

Increase total & free testosterone

Balance estrogen and DHT

Support dopamine with Velvet Bean Extract (25% L-Dopa)

Reduce prolactin (a hormone that kills libido and increases recovery time after orgasm)

No prescriptions or side effects. Just natural hormone optimization.

The Ultimate Drug Stack

Some clinics are now combining all 3 drugs:

Apomorphine – for dopamine and brain stimulation

Viagra – for rapid blood flow

Cialis – for long-lasting blood flow support

This is mostly a marketing tactic.

Cialis takes 40–60 minutes to work and lasts 36 hours — it doesn’t pair well with Apomorphine’s short half-life (about 1 hour).

Apomorphine Availability & Cost

Apomorphine is hard to get and expensive.

Injectable: $2,500 – $7,500 (for multiple doses)

Sublingual: $250 – $750 (for 30 tablets)

You’ll likely need to go through a compounding or international pharmacy for access.

Summary: Is Apomorphine Worth It?

Apomorphine works — but only for some men, especially those with mild ED or dopamine-related issues.

It’s not as proven or effective as Viagra or Cialis.

It’s expensive, prescription-only, and not FDA-approved for ED.

Want a natural alternative?

AlphaViril supports testosterone, dopamine, and reduces prolactin — all critical for stronger, more consistent erections.

No injections, prescriptions or side effects.

title: ❓ Can Testosterone Increase Penis Size? - Truth For 2025
content:
Today’s Q&A is: Can testosterone increase penis size?

Now, I’m not exactly sure what that question means specifically — but I assume the real question is: “Can higher levels of testosterone make your penis bigger?”

I’ll break it all down for you today.

And, you’ll find a free guide with tips on how to improve penis length, girth, and health naturally.

Does Testosterone Affect Penis Size?

The truth is: testosterone and androgens like DHT play a critical role in penis development — but only at certain stages in life.

During fetal development

These hormones — along with genetics and even estrogen — help determine your penis size.

If you’re still going through puberty, then optimizing your hormones (naturally!) could potentially maximize your growth.

But for adults? It’s a different story.

What Happens As You Get Older?

As men age, testosterone levels naturally decline and estrogen tends to rise. This can lead to:

Penile shrinkage or atrophy (yes, it’s real!)

It’s similar to how your biceps shrink with age — unless you actively work to maintain them.

What About Masturbation?

Too much masturbation can actually create negative hormonal imbalances — such as increased prolactin and cortisol, and reduced testosterone.

Many guys have told me, “I think my penis is getting smaller.”

And they’re right — because they’re overusing that “muscle.”

Penis Growth Is Like Going to the Gym

Think of it this way:

Genetics gives you your baseline

Hormones (like testosterone, DHT, and growth hormone) create the environment for growth

Exercises are the stimulus that can lead to size increases

Can you grow your penis by 3 inches overnight? No.

But gaining 0.5 to 2 inches over time is possible with the right approach.

But Be Careful — You Can Overtrain

Just like with lifting weights, doing too much can cause atrophy.

So follow the correct program, avoid overtraining, and be consistent.

What’s Realistically Possible?

You’re probably not going to have porn star size, but you can improve what you were born with.

Increased confidence, better performance, and improved prostate health are all benefits of getting this right.

Can Testosterone Alone Grow Your Penis?

If you’re past puberty, testosterone by itself won’t magically add size.

However, optimizing your hormone levels will support other growth strategies like:

Improved blood flow (via nitric oxide)

Reduced estrogen and cortisol

Want to Learn the Right Way?

I’ve created a free, in-depth guide on how to:

Increase penis size naturally

Improve erection quality

Boost testosterone levels safely

It’s all available below this article — no tricks, just science-backed strategies.

Yes, testosterone plays a role in penis growth — but mostly during puberty.

For adult men, the key is hormone optimization + proper training.

Combine the right techniques with the right mindset, and you can absolutely see real improvements in size, performance, and overall male health.

title: 🥚🥚 Bigger Balls in 2025? Clomid, TRT & Natural Boosters
content:
Today I want to talk about something I first heard about over 30 years ago — Clomid.

Back then, it was mostly used in the bodybuilding world, and later on, I even talked about it with porn stars… yeah, really.

I’ll break it all down — how it works, why people use it, the benefits, the downsides, and how to actually use it the smart way.

My Personal Experience With Clomid

I personally used Clomid about 25 years ago when I was looking to naturally boost my testosterone.

I didn’t want to take steroids. And after about a week or two, I noticed my testicles felt bigger and heavier.

Like, blue balls level at full.

I was producing so much sperm, my girlfriend joked she needed a raincoat. So, yeah… results.

But I also started getting moody.

Kinda down, sometimes emotional — even cried for no reason.

And at that age, everything was going well.

I didn’t connect the dots at first, but over time, I realized Clomid was likely the cause.

Oddly enough, my sex drive went down even though my testosterone was up.

So if you’re thinking about Clomid, or already on it, keep reading — I don’t want you making the same mistakes I did.

What Is Clomid and How Does It Work?

Clomid (Clomiphene Citrate) is an oral medication classified as a SERM — Selective Estrogen Receptor Modulator.

It was originally designed for women to treat infertility by increasing ovulation.

It works by blocking estrogen receptors in the brain, which tricks your body into thinking estrogen is low.

This signals the hypothalamus to release more GnRH, which triggers the pituitary to release more LH and FSH. In women, that means egg production.

In men, it stimulates the testicles to produce more testosterone and sperm.

Why Bodybuilders and Porn Stars Use It

I first heard about Clomid through bodybuilders.

After finishing a steroid cycle, their testicles would shrink and stop producing testosterone.

So they used Clomid (along with HCG and Nolvadex) during PCT (post-cycle therapy) to “wake up” their balls again.

Later on, when I lived in the Valley — the heart of the porn industry back in the ’90s — I consulted with adult film actors.

They wanted to increase their ejaculation volume.

I recommended Clomid for short bursts (about 5–7 days), which gave them noticeable results without the side effects that come from long-term use.

The Problem With Long-Term Clomid Use

Here’s the issue: Clomid was originally intended to be used for just 5–10 days in women.

But today, HRT clinics are prescribing it to men at 50 mg every day… indefinitely.

That’s a problem. Taking it long-term increases the risk of:

Mood swings and emotional instability

Reduced sex drive (even if testosterone is high)

Estrogen-like side effects despite estrogen being blocked

Resistance and adaptation — your body stops responding

Serious risks like blood clots, stroke, or heart attack (rare but real)

Most guys won’t feel these things immediately. It creeps up after a few weeks or months.

I’ve had tons of guys consult with me, all saying the same thing — “It worked great at first, now I feel worse.” Increasing the dose only makes it worse.

So What’s the Smart Way to Use It?

Over the years, I’ve found the best approach — and the one I used with those porn stars — is to cycle Clomid. Here’s a simple protocol that works:

1 week on Clomid (12.5–25 mg daily)

3–6 weeks on herbal testosterone boosters

This combo works because Clomid increases total testosterone, but not always free testosterone.

The right herbs (like in Alpha Viral) help boost free testosterone, and also help balance out DHT and estrogen.

That’s what keeps everything in harmony — testosterone levels, mood, libido, energy, and confidence.

Clomid vs. Enclomiphene (A Cleaner Version)

There are two types of Clomid: regular Clomiphene and the newer, cleaner version called Enclomiphene.

The regular version contains two isomers, and one of them tends to stick around and cause most of the moodiness and estrogenic side effects.

Has a shorter half-life

Fewer mood or vision side effects

Lower dosage required (12.5–25 mg)

That said, there’s not a lot of long-term safety data on Enclomiphene either. So my advice still stands — use it short-term only, cycle off, and support with proven herbal formulas.

Clomid vs. Testosterone Injections (TRT)

Let’s compare Clomid to testosterone injections:

TRT gives faster results, sure — but once you start, it’s hard to stop.

Your natural production shuts down, and it’s tough (and slow) to bounce back. I’ve seen it take guys months to recover… if at all.

Conclusion: What You Should Actually Do

If you’re thinking about using Clomid, here’s my recommendation:

Use Enclomiphene if possible (cleaner version)

Take it for one week max (12.5–25 mg daily)

Follow with 3–6 weeks of herbal testosterone boosters

Repeat as needed — but take breaks

Personally, I use Alpha Viril.

I’ve been taking it for over 25 years, and it works.

Or just copy the ingredients and buy them separately — I really don’t care.

What matters is that it works, it’s safe, and it keeps your hormones optimized.

Final tip: Don’t jump into TRT injections unless you’ve exhausted all other options. Once you start, it’s hard to stop.

Clomid – when used smartly – gives you a shot at boosting testosterone naturally, keeping your testicles working, and avoiding long-term side effects.

title: How I Grew My Penis By 2 Inches In 2025 What Actually Worked
content:
"Increase My Libido & Testosterone" Click HERE & Continue »

Can you actually increase your penis size by 2 inches — without surgery, pumps, or pills?

According to Dave Asprey, yes.

He claims he achieved this using stem cell injections and shockwave therapy.

A subscriber sent me this video, and in this article, I’ll break down what’s fact, what’s fiction, and how this compares to my personal experience — and what the science actually says.

Dave Asprey’s Claim: 2 Inches of Growth?

Dave Asprey has publicly claimed that he injected stem cells into his penis and saw a 2-inch increase in size — without drugs, exercises, or devices.

In addition to stem cells, he reportedly used:

PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) – for tissue regeneration

Shockwave Therapy – to stimulate blood flow and cellular repair

He shared a video at a biohacking conference, showing the procedure (censored), and discussed how it could help men with ED, aging tissue, and overall sexual performance — even for those without dysfunction.

Is It Scientifically Possible?

Stem cell therapy for penile growth is still controversial.

Some clinics offer it and claim success in improving both girth and length, especially when combined with shockwave therapy.

No FDA-approved studies confirm actual penis growth from stem cells

There’s no published clinical evidence supporting a 2-inch increase in length

These therapies are primarily used for ED, tissue repair, and blood flow improvements

In theory, improved circulation and tissue rejuvenation could help erections feel and look fuller — especially in older men.

But permanent anatomical growth?

That’s still unproven.

My Personal Experience With Stem Cells

I’ve had stem cells injected into both my shoulders — 20 million cells each — to repair joint damage.

Pain reduction and mobility improvement, but absolutely no increase in size.

And these are muscles that can grow from training — unlike the penis, which doesn’t respond the same way.

One of my friends also received stem cell therapy.

Same result: improved healing, zero size gain.

Why Bodybuilders Don’t Use It

If stem cells actually increased size by 2 inches or 33%, athletes and bodybuilders would be using them nonstop.

Bodybuilders already use extreme drugs to gain tiny fractions of size

If this worked, they’d be injecting stem cells into their biceps, chest, and glutes daily

But they don’t — because it simply doesn’t work for size gain in that way.

How Penis Growth Is Actually Possible

Yes, penis enlargement is possible, but it takes time and consistency.

Over the years, I’ve helped many men achieve gains of 0.5 to 2 inches — using a combination of:

Penis-specific exercises

Targeted supplements that improve blood flow, elasticity, and tissue health

Hormonal support to improve responsiveness

However, it’s important to understand — this takes months, sometimes over a year.

It’s gradual and not instant, but it’s achievable and backed by real-world results.

I’ve included a free guide that shows the exact steps you can follow. It’s yours to download.

What About Growth Hormone Injections?

Some people have tried injecting growth hormone directly into the penis.

One bodybuilder I know tried this for months — injecting multiple times per week.

He reported a slightly “fuller” look, but no real increase in size.

Eventually, he started combining the injections with exercises from my program.

Months later, he saw measurable improvement — about 1 inch in length and 0.5 inch in girth.

Hormones may help, but only when paired with exercises that actually stimulate tissue expansion — much like building muscle at the gym.

The Science of Penis Growth (and Its Limits)

Penis size, like all organs and limbs, is largely genetically predetermined and influenced during two key life stages:

Puberty — when hormones like testosterone and growth hormone surge

Once puberty ends and growth plates close, further natural organ growth is unlikely.

Stem cells in adults are primarily for repair and regeneration — not for increasing anatomical dimensions beyond your genetic set point.

Final Thoughts: Can You Really Grow Your Penis?

So, can stem cells grow your penis by 2 inches?

Scientifically, it’s highly doubtful.

There’s no peer-reviewed evidence, and even Dave Asprey hasn’t shared before-and-after proof or measurements.

That said, improvements in erection quality, tissue health, and blood flow are real benefits of regenerative therapies.

But anatomical growth?

That likely comes from consistent effort using targeted exercises and supplements.

If you’re serious about increasing penis size and improving performance, I made free, step-by-step guide.

It’s based on years of real-world experience and thousands of success stories.

title: 💊10 Medications That Kill Testosterone & Libido In 2025
content:
When I consult guys about their testosterone, libido, and sex drive issues, every guy quickly focuses on how to increase their testosterone levels.

Which makes sense since testosterone makes you more “manly” – physically, emotionally and sexually.

However, before you can fix the problem, you need to know the cause.

In this case — why is your testosterone low? Why do you have a low drive?

Sadly, most guys don’t realize that some of the most popular prescription drugs, including over-the-counter ones, can lower testosterone and cause erectile problems.

Top Medications That Lower Testosterone & Cause ED

With that said, here are 10 popular medications that can lower testosterone levels and contribute to erectile dysfunction.

1. NSAIDs (e.g., Ibuprofen, Naproxen) and Erectile Dysfunction

Study Findings: A 2011 study in The Journal of Urology found that regular NSAID use (≥2x/week) was associated with a 22% increased risk of ED.

Mechanism: NSAIDs inhibit prostaglandins, which are crucial for vasodilation and blood flow.

2. Acetaminophen (Tylenol) and Testosterone Suppression

Not technically an NSAID, but still impacts prostaglandin pathways.

Hormonal Impact: High doses may disrupt the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis, reducing testosterone.

Liver Stress: Chronic use affects liver function, which is essential for hormone metabolism.

3. Blood Pressure Medications (Antihypertensives)

Beta-blockers: (e.g., Metoprolol, Propranolol) – May impair penile blood flow and cause low libido.

Diuretics: (e.g., Hydrochlorothiazide) – Deplete zinc and reduce testosterone levels.

Calcium channel blockers: (e.g., Amlodipine) – Some users report erectile problems.

ACE inhibitors: (e.g., Lisinopril) – Mild effects on erectile function but still worth monitoring.

4. Antidepressants & Psychiatric Medications

SSRIs: (e.g., Prozac, Zoloft, Lexapro, Paxil) – Reduce libido, delay orgasm, and cause ED. Paxil is the worst offender.

SNRIs: (e.g., Effexor, Cymbalta) – Have similar sexual side effects as SSRIs.

TCAs: (e.g., Amitriptyline) – May reduce nerve function and blood flow.

Antipsychotics: (e.g., Risperdal, Zyprexa, Haldol) – Increase prolactin, which suppresses testosterone and libido.

5. Opioids and Pain Medications

Opioids: (e.g., Oxycodone, Morphine, Fentanyl) – Cause opioid-induced hypogonadism by lowering testosterone production.

Combined use with NSAIDs or Tylenol: Further reduces blood flow and testosterone levels.

6. Hormonal Medications

Finasteride & Dutasteride: (Propecia, Avodart) – Block DHT; known to cause low libido, ED, and even post-finasteride syndrome (PFS).

Corticosteroids: (e.g., Prednisone) – Can suppress testosterone in just a few days.

7. Anti-seizure & Nerve Pain Medications

Gabapentin, Pregabalin: May blunt dopamine and reduce nerve sensitivity, lowering sexual arousal.

Topiramate: Often used for migraines or epilepsy — may reduce libido.

8. Statins (Cholesterol-Lowering Drugs)

Examples include Lipitor, Zocor.

Statins lower cholesterol — but since testosterone is made from cholesterol, these drugs can lower hormone production.

9. H2 Blockers (Acid Reducers)

Examples: Ranitidine (Zantac), Cimetidine (Tagamet).

Tagamet in particular can lower testosterone and raise estrogen levels.

10. Blood Sugar Lowering Drugs

Metformin: Suppresses LH and testosterone, lowers sperm count, raises SHBG (which binds to testosterone).

TZDs: (e.g., Actos, Avandia) – Raise SHBG and lower free testosterone.

You’re Probably Taking One of These Drugs

Sadly, I know so many people who are taking at least one of these drugs regularly or many times a week.

Now, I’m not here to tell you to stop taking your medications. You’ll need to speak to your doctor about this.

Sometimes there are alternative drugs, but those will usually have similar negatives since they accomplish a similar goal, using a similar unnatural pathway.

Natural Alternatives to Consider

I’ve listed natural herbal remedies below if you want to try safer solutions.

However, supplements can never replace drugs because drugs are very powerful. Unfortunately, they also have lots of negative side effects and can be addictive.

On the other hand, most people also do NOT need drugs. It’s just the medical system immediately wants to prescribe you a drug since that’s what they’re taught in school — and the whole system is run by big pharma.

What You Actually Need: Lifestyle Fixes

What we need to do is improve our lifestyle: eating better, moving more, sleeping better, and adding nutrients we might be lacking — since nobody has the perfect diet.

Summary: Stop the Damage Before It Gets Worse

Increasing your testosterone levels is a great idea, and I’ve made a lot of different videos about it in the past.

However, just as important — maybe even more — is reducing or eliminating the drugs that lower testosterone and cause erectile dysfunction.

Because the older we get, the worse the problems become and the more damage these drugs can cause over time.

Remember, your body is not deficient in a synthetic drug. It’s lacking nutrients, movement, and a healthy lifestyle.

Watch the full video above to learn more and check the natural options to help you start restoring your testosterone — the right way.

title: What’s The #1 ED Pill For Harder & Bigger Erections In 2025
content:
"Increase My Libido & Testosterone" Click HERE & Continue »

Today’s topic is extremely important — what’s the best ED pill for harder and bigger erections, based on the latest clinical studies?

If you’re looking for erections on demand, this article is perfect for you.

I’ll cover which drugs are most effective, based on science, and also share some personal experiences and practical tips.

Real-Life Example: Why This Matters

Recently, I received an email from a man trying to get his wife pregnant.

A year ago, his testosterone was only 382.

After following my advice, it’s now up to 807, and his sperm quality has improved.

He takes Alpha Viril, Vitamin D & K, fish oil, magnesium, and zinc.

His erections are better — but there’s a problem.

Due to his wife’s ovulation timing, he sometimes struggles to get an erection on command.

Stress and fatigue don’t help. So, he asked about using an ED drug like Viagra or Cialis, and which one works best.

Here’s the breakdown.

Understanding ED Pills (PDE5 Inhibitors)

There are 4–5 common ED drugs.

These are known as PDE5 inhibitors, and they work by increasing blood flow to the penis.

Originally designed to lower blood pressure, they require sexual stimulation (mental or physical) to work — they won’t cause erections on their own.

Important Note: These drugs work better when your testosterone levels are higher.

In fact, around 40% of men don’t respond to ED drugs due to low testosterone. The younger you are, the better they tend to work.

Differences in Half-Life & Onset

The biggest difference between these drugs is their half-life — how long they stay in your system — and how quickly they take effect.

Viagra & Levitra: Half-life of 4–6 hours, onset in ~30 minutes. Viagra works best on an empty stomach.

Stendra: Half-life of 6–10 hours, onset in ~15 minutes. Can be taken with food.

Cialis: Longest half-life: 24–36 hours. Onset time ~45–60 minutes. Ideal for weekend use or consistent readiness.

If you take 50 mg of Viagra at 8:00 AM, about 25 mg remains in your system 4–6 hours later.

Even after 8–12 hours, a smaller amount is still active.

The same principle applies to Cialis, which can stay in your body for up to two days.

Tip: Take on an Empty Stomach

Although some can be taken with food, they all work best on an empty stomach.

Ideally, wait 2 hours after eating and 30–60 minutes before your next meal.

For faster absorption, grind the pill and let it dissolve under your tongue. This bypasses the digestive system and speeds up effects.

Clinical Study Results

A large meta-analysis compared the effectiveness across the most common ED pills:

Viagra (50 mg): 47% improvement in erections

Levitra (10 mg): 35% improvement

Cialis (10 mg): 33% improvement

Stendra (100 mg): 29% improvement

These were average doses — not maximum — but Viagra ranked highest in overall effectiveness.

Potential Side Effects

Common side effects include:

Note: A friend of mine collapsed and hit his head due to a sudden blood pressure drop — so be careful, especially when combining with alcohol or other meds.

Which Has the Fewest Side Effects?

Cialis (10 mg) had the lowest rate of side effects at 10%, while Viagra had the highest at 18%.

This makes sense since Cialis is a slower-acting medication with a more gradual effect.

Which ED Pill Should You Choose?

While I can’t offer medical advice, here’s what to consider:

Need fast results? Try Viagra or Stendra

Want all-day or weekend readiness? Go with Cialis

Sensitive to side effects? Start with the lowest dose of Cialis

Everyone responds differently.

Some prefer Viagra, others Cialis.

Always start with the lowest dose and increase only if needed. It saves money and helps you avoid unnecessary side effects.

Additional Tips & Warnings

Don’t use ED drugs daily — your body will adapt, reducing effectiveness.

Cycling between drugs (e.g., Viagra one week, Cialis another) may help.

Testosterone optimization improves ED drug response.

Don’t become psychologically dependent — use ED drugs as needed, not as a crutch.

Finally, boosting your testosterone naturally will enhance results.

Whether you’re trying to conceive or simply want reliable performance, ED medications can help — but use them wisely and sparingly.

content:
Today, it’s 2025 and I want to talk about what may be the most powerful legal testosterone booster available — HCG (Human Chorionic Gonadotropin).

I’ll explain how it works, the benefits, side effects, and how it’s used by everyone from bodybuilders and porn stars to regular men trying to improve fertility or support TRT.

HCG is a hormone naturally produced in the body, especially during pregnancy.

In fact, pregnancy tests detect HCG levels in urine or blood to confirm pregnancy.

If you’re unsure whether you have real HCG, you can apply a drop to a pregnancy test strip — if it shows positive, it’s legit.

Unfortunately, HCG has become very expensive — around $300 per vial — even though it used to be far more affordable.

HCG is administered via injection and works similarly to Clomid by signaling the body to produce more testosterone, but HCG is injectable, while Clomid is oral.

Medically, HCG is used to:

Induce ovulation in women as part of fertility treatments

Stimulate testosterone and sperm production in men with low testosterone

Help testicles descend in young boys with undescended testes

Common Side Effects & Warnings

Important: This is not medical advice. Always consult your doctor before using hormone-based therapies.

Despite raising testosterone, HCG can cause the following side effects:

Fatigue or irritability

Mood swings or mild depression

Increased hair loss (via DHT)

Gynecomastia (breast tenderness or growth in men)

Why does this happen?

HCG tends to spike testosterone and then convert more of it into estrogen and DHT — especially in older men or those with higher body fat.

This can lead to a hormone imbalance if not managed correctly.

Signs of high estrogen may include moodiness, water retention, sensitive nipples, or breast discomfort.

You can also confirm via blood tests (check estradiol, testosterone, LH, and FSH levels).

How Bodybuilders Use HCG

In the bodybuilding world, HCG is commonly used to restore testicular size and function after steroid or testosterone use.

Steroids shut down natural testosterone production, causing testicles to shrink.

To recover, bodybuilders typically do a post-cycle therapy (PCT) using:

A smarter method is to prevent shrinkage by using small HCG doses during the steroid or TRT cycle — such as 250 IU, 2–3 times per week.

This helps maintain natural testosterone production and testicular size.

However: Combining TRT with HCG increases the need to manage estrogen and DHT using aromatase inhibitors (e.g., Arimidex), which can introduce new complications like hair loss or prostate issues.

How Porn Stars Use HCG

In the 1990s, I met several porn actors who used HCG to increase ejaculation volume and boost libido.

While Clomid was often used in short 5–7 day cycles followed by herbs, HCG gave stronger, faster results.

Typical protocol: 2,500 IU of HCG taken 2–3 days before a shoot.

Recommended Usage Strategy

The best way to use HCG is to cycle it smartly:

Follow with 3–6 weeks of natural herbal testosterone boosters

This helps maintain testosterone levels without excessive estrogen buildup.

Many of my clients use AlphaViril during the off weeks — not only for testosterone but also to balance DHT, estrogen, and dopamine.

Dopamine plays a major role in sex drive.

Over time, as dopamine levels drop (in relationships or with aging), desire and motivation fade.

Porn stars often use dopamine-boosting herbs and amino acids to stay mentally “in the mood.”

AlphaViril contains Velvet Bean Extract, which provides L-DOPA — a precursor to dopamine.

Many of my clients find this helps reignite their sex drive naturally, especially when combined with HCG or Clomid.

HCG can be incredibly effective – but only when used correctly and in moderation.

I always recommend starting with natural solutions like AlphaViril or short Clomid cycles before considering injections or full-blown testosterone replacement therapy (TRT).

Once you’re on TRT, it’s often a lifelong commitment with many moving parts — including managing testicles, estrogen, DHT, and mental drive.

So use HCG strategically, and go natural for as long as possible.

content:
There’s a natural food — backed by science, animal studies, and real user feedback in 2025 — that may help increase your testicle size and boost testosterone.

The Surprising Question Men Keep Asking

The Shocking Study That Started It All

Researchers made a surprising discovery when testing mice with a specific type of yogurt containing a probiotic called Lactobacillus reuteri (L. Reuteri).

Testicles grew by 15%

And yes, it was directly tied to the presence of L. Reuteri in their gut.

But Does It Work in Humans?

Mouse studies don’t always match human biology — but in this case, there’s promising evidence.

Human studies show L. Reuteri may support:

Improved semen quality

Increased testosterone levels

Lower inflammation (IL-17)

Improved digestion and gut lining

Reduced obesity and autoimmune issues

Back in the 1960s, 40% of people had this healthy bacterium.

Today? Only 10–15%. That could explain a lot of men’s modern health problems.

Why Yogurt Doesn’t Work Anymore

Don’t just grab yogurt off the shelf — most American yogurts only contain 2–5 strains of bacteria, and L. Reuteri is rarely one of them.

The Better Option: Kefir

Kefir [kuh-feer] is a fermented milk drink with more diverse probiotic strains, including L. Reuteri.

It’s typically made from cow, goat, or sheep milk.

Tips for Best Results:

Choose goat or sheep milk kefir for better casein compatibility

Avoid sweetened or flavored versions – sugar kills probiotic benefits

Make sure L. Reuteri is on the label

What About Supplements?

Some people prefer probiotic pills.

If you go that route, you MUST find the L. Reuteri strain ATCC PTA 6475 on the label.

But here’s the problem — a randomized controlled trial showed no significant testosterone increases in men (ages 50–65) after 12 weeks of L. Reuteri supplements.

Bottom line: Skip the pills and stick to real kefir for the most benefits.

How to Use Kefir for Best Results

Drink 1 cup daily for at least 3 months.

It’s not a quick fix — but the long-term benefits are worth it.

Real Feedback From Users

Many men who followed this protocol shared in the comments:

If you don’t like kefir, you’re not alone — I don’t either.

That’s why I personally use a blend of herbs and vitamins that work faster and improve erection quality too.

I’ve used it for 25+ years, and thousands of men have had great results.

Bonus: How to Make Kefir at Home (Save Money!)

Get kefir grains (starter culture – online or health stores)

Use 1–2 tbsp of grains + 2 cups of milk (goat/sheep/cow – preferably whole)

Put it in a glass jar and cover with cheesecloth or a paper towel

Let it ferment at room temp (65–85°F) for 24–48 hours

Strain the grains and store the finished kefir in a glass bottle in the fridge

The grains are reusable indefinitely, so you can keep making batch after batch at home.

But the good news is that there are 3 clinically backed foods that naturally support higher testosterone, stronger erections, increased libido, and improved body composition.

They taste good, are easy to find, and work in both studies and real-world results.

For over 25 years, I’ve helped men naturally improve testosterone, sex drive, energy, and body composition — starting with my own hormonal imbalances at just 19.

Now in my 50s, my testosterone is still high — and these foods are part of why.

1. Whole Eggs (Pasture-Raised)

Whole eggs are the #1 testosterone-boosting food I recommend — specifically pasture-raised eggs with bright yellow yolks.

The yolk contains cholesterol, which is the building block for testosterone production.

Testosterone, DHEA, and other key sex hormones are made from cholesterol, and low-cholesterol diets or statins often lead to low libido and erectile problems.

Eggs also provide a perfect combination of high-quality protein and healthy fats that raise your body’s good HDL cholesterol, not harmful LDL.

Study results: In a 12-week study with resistance-trained men (avg. age 24), those who ate 3 whole eggs post-workout saw a 240 ng/dL increase in testosterone compared to just 70 ng/dL in the egg-white group — that’s over 3.5x more.

Fat loss: -2.7% body fat (vs. -1.7% in egg-white group)

Muscle strength: 11.2% improvement in knee extension (vs. 8.6%)

My protocol: I eat 3 whole eggs daily, usually at night.

Why? Your body produces testosterone overnight, and cholesterol is needed for that process — so consuming it before bed works better for me.

Plus, eggs are low-carb and easy to digest.

2. Grass-Fed Red Meat (Especially Bison)

Red meat — especially grass-fed beef or bison — is a testosterone powerhouse.

It’s rich in saturated fats, cholesterol, zinc, iron, and other micronutrients essential for hormone production and muscle growth.

Old-school bodybuilders like Arnold Schwarzenegger swore by “steak and eggs” — and they built size with minimal steroid use compared to today’s standards.

It’s leaner, cleaner, and contains more nutrients than standard beef.

If you can’t afford bison, opt for grass-fed beef, which has a better fat profile and fewer hormones compared to grain-fed alternatives.

Plus, red meat keeps you full, supports lean mass, and has been shown to raise testosterone in men with low intake of animal fats.

3. Oysters (Or Zinc Supplements)

Oysters have long been known as a natural aphrodisiac — and for good reason.

They’re the most concentrated food source of zinc, a mineral that plays a critical role in testosterone production, sperm quality, and libido.

Reduces estrogen (less fat gain, less gynecomastia)

Lowers DHT (reduces hair loss and prostate risk)

Improves testosterone output and hormone balance

Unfortunately, many people are deficient in zinc — especially if they eat a plant-based diet or don’t consume enough seafood or red meat.

Neither do I. That’s why I recommend taking a zinc supplement with copper to avoid deficiency symptoms like fatigue, white/gray hair, and brain fog.

Recommended zinc-to-copper ratio: 10–15 mg of zinc to 1 mg of copper. Too much zinc without copper can create an imbalance and lead to neurological issues.

I personally use a supplement that combines zinc, copper, and 12 other ingredients clinically proven to support testosterone, libido, and erection quality.

There’s no magic food that will boost your testosterone overnight.

But if you consistently include the right nutrients — like eggs, grass-fed meat, and zinc — you’ll notice real, sustainable changes in energy, drive, performance, and body composition.

These 3 foods are a core part of my diet, and I’ve seen the results in my own bloodwork — including a total testosterone level of 1,157 ng/dL in my 50s (up from 992 a year earlier).

Yes, lifestyle, sleep, and supplements matter — but food is the foundation.

If you’re looking for a natural, sustainable way to improve your hormones, start with what’s on your plate.

title: NEVER Do This To Your Penis - 10 Things To Avoid In 2025
content:
Today it’s 2025, and we’re going to cover 10 critical things you should never do to your penis — if you care about your health, confidence, and sex life.

This isn’t clickbait — it’s real, practical, and potentially life-changing.

1. Don’t Ignore Erectile Dysfunction

If your erections aren’t as strong as they used to be, it’s not just about sex — it could be a warning sign of heart disease, poor blood flow, blood sugar issues, high blood pressure, or hormonal imbalances.

Get your hormones, blood sugar, and cardiovascular health checked.

A simple blood test is a great start. ED is often the “canary in the coal mine.”

2. Urination Warnings

Frequent urination, especially at night, or a weakening urine stream can signal prostate issues — from inflammation to cancer.

Get a prostate exam and blood tests (PSA, testosterone, estrogen, DHT). Prostate problems are very treatable when caught early.

3. Don’t Neglect Hygiene

Poor hygiene can lead to infections, bad odor, and turn your partner off — especially if you’re uncircumcised.

Wash gently with mild soap and warm water.

Clean under the foreskin if applicable. Twice daily if uncircumcised.

4. Don’t Ignore Pain, Lumps, or Ulcers

Any unusual swelling, pain, or sores should not be ignored.

It could be an STI, urinary issue, or, in rare cases, cancer.

See a doctor immediately. Early detection = better outcomes.

5. Don’t Skip Protection or Go Too Hard

Unprotected sex risks disease and pregnancy. And yes, you can fracture your penis during rough sex.

Use condoms and lubrication.

If something pops or swells painfully, get to the ER fast.

6. Don’t Overheat the Goods

Your testicles need to stay cool to produce sperm and testosterone. Heat throws that off.

Avoid prolonged exposure to hot tubs, saunas, or heat from laptops and phones.

Ice packs during saunas can help.

7. Don’t Use the ‘Death Grip’

Aggressive masturbation reduces sensitivity, making it harder to enjoy real sex.

Use lubrication and go gentler.

Mimic real sex to avoid unrealistic pressure conditioning.

8. Don’t Smoke (Ever)

Smoking destroys blood flow, testosterone, and bladder health. It’s a direct route to erectile dysfunction.

For your erections, if not your heart.

9. Don’t Beat Yourself Up

Performance anxiety kills confidence.

Comparing yourself to porn or others only makes things worse.

Talk to a therapist or urologist if needed. One bad night doesn’t define your manhood.

10. Don’t Stop Using It

No erections — including morning wood — can lead to penile tissue hardening and shrinkage.

Optimize testosterone and hormone levels.

Keep your drive and erections alive. Regular erections are vital for penile health.

Let me ask you, can your penis really shrink? I’m 57 years old, by the way. Please help.”

Umm… I don’t even know where to start. That’s a very painful thing to hear. I’m assuming she wasn’t trying to be hurtful. Maybe you should have asked her if her vagina was getting bigger?! LOL…

Anyway, let’s dig into this and help grow back your penis, so you can feel more confident.

Yes, the Penis Can Shrink With Age

However, penis shrinkage can happen even when you’re younger — in your 20s and 30s. Let’s go over the most common causes:

1. Hormonal Imbalance

This is one of the biggest causes of penis shrinkage.

As you age, your testosterone levels decrease and estrogen increases, creating a hormonal imbalance.

The penis is still a muscle — different than your biceps, but still influenced by testosterone, which supports growth and strength.

Aging reduces blood flow and circulation throughout the body — including the penis. Poor circulation affects erection strength, size, and fullness.

Excess fat around the belly and pubic area makes the penis appear smaller.

Research from 2014 found that 15–68% of patients experienced shrinkage after prostate gland removal (prostatectomy).

6. “Use It Or Lose It”

The penis is a muscle — and if you don’t use it, you lose it.

title: 🤥 10 Myths About Testosterone Every Man Should Know In 2025
content:
It’s 2025 now, and these days, testosterone is a big topic, especially with the rise of TRT and HRT clinics.

Unfortunately, much of the information out there is incorrect or made up.

Some popular influencer, podcast, or YouTuber says something… and then everyone else repeats the same junk. It’s the blind leading the blind.

Even I’ve fallen for some of these testosterone myths.

With my background in endocrinology and over two decades of consulting athletes, bodybuilders, and everyday guys, today I’m going to quickly expose the top 10 common myths about testosterone.

Myth #1: Testosterone Is Just About Sex Drive

Sure, testosterone impacts libido and erections.

But it also plays a huge role in muscle mass, body fat, mood, motivation, memory, and cardiovascular health.

Low T isn’t just a bedroom issue—it’s a whole-body issue.

So if you’re feeling tired, weak, depressed, or losing muscle… it might not be “just aging.” It could be low testosterone.

Myth #2: High Testosterone Is Bad or Dangerous

For years, we’ve heard that high testosterone causes cancer, heart attacks, mood swings, and mental problems.

The reality? Naturally high testosterone is extremely beneficial for your brain, mood, muscle mass, heart, prostate, metabolism, and more.

The real danger is in how testosterone converts into estrogen and DHT. Poorly executed TRT—not testosterone itself—is the true issue.

Myth #3: Only Older Men Have Low Testosterone

Today, even men as young as 20 experience low T due to:

Plastics and endocrine disruptors

Use of drugs, including marijuana, antidepressants, sleeping meds, and alcohol

Testosterone isn’t just about age—it’s about lifestyle.

Myth #4: Natural Boosters Don’t Work

Most testosterone boosters are garbage, but certain natural ingredients—like tongkat ali, ashwagandha, fenugreek, boron, tribulus, and horny goat weed – do have clinical research backing them.

When combined correctly, they work, especially when they also help balance estrogen, DHT, cortisol, dopamine, and prolactin.

I’ve used AlphaViril for over 25 years with guaranteed results or your money back plus $100 cash.

Myth #5: Low Testosterone Is Part Of Aging

While testosterone does decline with age, low T in older men isn’t normal.

My recent blood test showed a level of 1057 – in my 50s.

Many clients in their 40s to 70s have doubled or tripled their T levels naturally. You may not reach your 20s peak, but you shouldn’t be in the low range either.

Myth #6: High Testosterone Causes Aggression or “Roid” Rage

Low testosterone is more often linked to irritability and depression.

“Roid rage” is mostly connected to extremely high doses of certain steroids, not testosterone itself.

High estrogen, not testosterone, has been linked to increased aggression.

Myth #7: Testosterone Makes You Go Bald

Hair loss is largely genetic.

The real issue isn’t testosterone—it’s DHT (dihydrotestosterone), a variant of testosterone.

Higher DHT = more hair loss.

Ironically, TRT can worsen hair loss due to flawed protocols.

If you’re interested in preventing balding, let me know – I may create a video about it.

Myth #8: “If Your Total Testosterone Is Normal, That’s All That Matters”

Free testosterone, SHBG, estradiol, DHT, cortisol levels, and symptoms all matter.

You can have “normal” testosterone and still feel terrible, or have low libido and performance.

Myth #9: Testosterone Causes Prostate Cancer

This outdated myth still persists.

If high testosterone caused prostate cancer, teenagers would be most at risk—not older men with low T.

High estrogen and imbalanced DHT/testosterone ratios.

Healthy hormone balance – not just low T – is key for prostate health.

AlphaViril was designed to raise testosterone while reducing excess estrogen, prolactin, and DHT to optimize hormone ratios.

Myth #10: You Need To Inject Testosterone To Raise It

You don’t need injections.

Sure, they’re the fastest method, but they also risk the most side effects when mismanaged.

TRT clinics often prioritize profits over your health. Before even considering TRT:

Use proven supplements, vitamins, and minerals

Reduce testosterone-killing drugs like pot and alcohol

If you still have low testosterone afterward, then consider TRT. A healthy body responds better to lower TRT doses with fewer side effects.

The problem with social media is that there’s too much information, and a lot of it is wrong.

Most people want less noise, but more clarity.

That’s why I’m creating a short Testosterone Blueprint guide – it covers lifestyle, diet, supplements, blood tests, drugs, and everything else you need to know.

It’s free for my subscribers and should be ready soon.

title: ❓ Are Clitoral Erections Fact Or Myth In 2025?
content:
Today, I’ve got a really interesting question — one that I’ve never been asked before:

“Dr. Sam, since I’ve been taking the AlphaViril testosterone booster, I’m having a lot more erections, especially while sleeping and in the morning. In fact, when I get up to pee in the middle of the night, I now have erections half the time, like when I was younger.

However, my question is for my girlfriend — can she take AlphaViril to boost her testosterone and sex drive? And this is going to sound stupid, but can the clitoris get erect or grow like the penis, and have morning erections… or is that just a guy thing?”

The answer is yes — the clitoris can and does get erect, just like a penis. I’ll explain that more in a minute.

But first, let’s talk about your nighttime and morning erections, known as Nocturnal Erections.

Nocturnal Erections: What You Should Know

Most men experience 3–5 erections per night during healthy sleep.

They occur primarily during REM sleep cycles.

Each erection typically lasts 25–35 minutes.

Total erection time can range from 1.5 to 3 hours per night.

The final morning erection may last longer — hence the term “morning wood.”

Healthy men experience nocturnal erections from infancy through old age.

Rigidity and frequency peak in late teens and early 20s.

Decline with age is due to hormonal changes and poor blood flow.

Complete absence of nocturnal erections is not normal at any age and can indicate a health issue.

Nighttime erections are typically 80–100% rigid.

They don’t always relate to sexual dreams.

Blood flow increases by 3–8x normal levels during these erections.

Bottom line: Assuming you’re healthy and your hormones are balanced, you’re getting multiple erections while you sleep — even if you don’t always notice them.

From Penis to Clitoris — What About Women?

The same biological principles apply to women. The clitoris is very similar to a penis — it just doesn’t contain a urethra.

In fact, if you’ve ever seen an enlarged clitoris in women with high testosterone (like female bodybuilders who take steroids), it can resemble a small penis.

How Erections Work in Both Men & Women

Both contain spongy tissue that fills with blood.

When muscles relax, blood flows in and fills the area.

The tissue becomes longer, thicker, and more sensitive.

Just like a penis, the clitoris becomes engorged and more sensitive during arousal. It’s clitoral erection.

The tip of the clitoris is extremely sensitive — in fact, it’s said to contain over 10,000 nerve fibers, making it even more sensitive than the tip of the penis.

Hormonal Pulses & Morning Erections

Your body’s hormones — including testosterone, estrogen, insulin, growth hormone, cortisol, and others — are released in pulses, not continuously throughout the day.

This is why natural testosterone production often produces better results than hormone replacement therapy.

Testosterone is the primary hormone responsible for erections, both in men and women.

Testosterone peaks in the morning, which is why we get “Morning Wood” in men and what I call “Morning Bean” in women.

Sexual Arousal: Men vs. Women

Just as a man’s penis gets erect during arousal and sex, so does the clitoris.

Both organs become bigger, fuller, and more sensitive during sexual stimulation.

As stated earlier, women do experience nocturnal and morning clitoral erections.

Can Women Take AlphaViril?

Yes — AlphaViril can help boost sex drive in women as well, by naturally optimizing testosterone levels.

However, women only need a lower dose than men. The formula works the same way, just with less required.

Men and women both experience nighttime and morning erections.

The clitoris works like a penis, just smaller — but with even more sensitivity.

Testosterone drives erections in both sexes, and AlphaViril can help when taken properly.

title: With THIS Kind Of VOICE You'll Get Laid More In 2025
content:
I’ve always had a deep voice — and honestly, I didn’t realize how much of a difference it made until I got older and noticed how women reacted differently to me.

They’d lean in, smile more, ask more questions — and it became especially obvious when I’d call them on the phone.

I’d constantly hear, “Hey, I really like your voice.”

Turns out, science backs this up. Women are biologically wired to respond to certain types of voices.

Your Voice Is Like an Audio Fingerprint

What most guys don’t realize is that your voice says a lot about you, without you saying much at all.

Studies from universities like UCL and McMaster show that women consistently rate lower-pitched voices as more attractive.

Because a deeper voice is subconsciously linked to:

Higher testosterone levels

It’s primal. Her brain hears your voice, and in milliseconds, it makes a decision: Safe or sexy? Strong or skip?

One study even found that women prefer deeper voices during ovulation, when they’re most fertile, further proving that her biology is tuned to detect these cues of masculinity.

Another study showed that men with deeper voices had more sexual partners. Coincidence? Maybe… but probably not.

And it’s not just about dating. CEOs with deeper voices are seen as more competent and make more money.

Your voice influences how people respond to you in business and life.

What Makes a Voice Attractive?

It’s not just pitch — there are five key elements that make a voice attractive:

Lower frequencies tend to be more attractive, but not too low. Think Batman smooth, not robotic.

A rich, chesty tone with vibration. Avoid sounding nasal or too “heady.” Speak from the chest.

Speaking slowly signals confidence. Rushing your words makes you seem nervous.

Clear, crisp pronunciation shows confidence and intelligence. Don’t mumble.

Controlling silence creates tension and shows control. Learn to pause — it’s powerful.

You Can Train Your Voice

The good news is — you don’t have to be born with a deep voice.

You can actually train your voice to sound more masculine and attractive.

I’ve created a video series on exactly how to do this.

But here’s the deal: Most guys get this wrong. When they get nervous, their voice goes higher, they start talking faster, and they talk too much. That kills attraction.

Speak from your chest

This is what communicates confidence, calm, and control.

Your Voice Impacts Every Area of Your Life

How you sound affects how you’re treated by women, men, and even in business settings.

I’ve had guys message me after watching my voice training videos and say:

“Dude, women are reacting totally differently to me now.”

And it’s not just the voice — it’s the way they speak and communicate. You don’t have to be born with it. It’s a skill you can develop.

Testosterone thickens the vocal cords and helps deepen your voice naturally, which is why I talk about it so often.

title: 🔺 7 Ways To Increase Testosterone In 2025, At Any Age
content:
I’ve made lots of videos and articles about increasing testosterone levels.

But today, it’s 2025 and I’m simplifying and summarizing the best lifetime testosterone-boosting and hormone-optimizing methods you can use forever, regardless of your age or current testosterone levels.

This isn’t about trendy tactics.

It’s about natural, clinically and empirically backed methods that actually work in the real world.

We’ll start with the harder lifestyle changes and end with the easiest and fastest ways to boost testosterone.

1. Optimize Your Diet

Constantly dieting or eating at a caloric deficit increases stress hormones, which can lower testosterone levels.

But eating too many calories and becoming overweight raises estrogen, which also lowers testosterone.

You must balance cortisol and estrogen to optimize testosterone levels.

You need to consume fats, especially from sources with cholesterol, which is crucial for hormone production.

I eat 2–3 whole eggs a few times a week (about a dozen per week).

The yolk is beneficial for testosterone.

Avoid omega-6 fats from seeds and vegetable oils.

Instead, supplement with omega-3 fish oil (2–5g/day) and 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil.

Carbs increase insulin, which helps boost total and free testosterone.

You don’t need a high-carb diet, but some healthy, low-sugar, unprocessed carbs are beneficial.

Keto and carnivore diets typically lower testosterone.

Animal protein boosts testosterone.

Focus on whole eggs, grass-fed meats, pasture-raised chicken, and wild-caught fish.

I also add in whey isolate protein when I’m busy.

Avoid processed meats and cheap protein sources.

Eat about 1 gram of protein per pound of body weight.

Eat 4–5 smaller meals daily. Intermittent fasting is not ideal for testosterone.

If You Need to Lose Fat

Try to burn more calories through exercise rather than drastically cutting food intake.

2. Improve Your Sleep

Sleep is critical for hormone production, especially testosterone and growth hormone.

Cutting sleep to 5 hours a night can plummet testosterone levels in just days.

Most people need 7–8 hours of quality sleep.

The best test? Wake up without an alarm and feel energized throughout the day. If you need coffee or pre-workouts to function, you’re sleep-deprived.

Go to bed around 10 PM and wake up naturally.

And if you suffer from sleep apnea, it’s absolutely killing your testosterone.

3. Exercise the Right Way

Resistance training is #1 for testosterone.

Use weights, machines, or cables—whatever you prefer.

Train 3–5 times per week for about 1 hour.

More than that increases cortisol and lowers testosterone.

Limit strenuous cardio. Too much can raise cortisol.

Instead, do brisk walks for 10–20 minutes in the morning and around meals.

Do this 2–4 times daily, totaling 20 to 75 minutes of light movement per day.

Stress increases cortisol, which suppresses testosterone. Learn to manage both physical and emotional stress.

Get rid of toxic people

Limit exposure to negative media

Stop obsessing over the past or worrying about unlikely future events

Exercise in moderation

Stimulate your brain with new learning

It’s easier said than done, but you must act, not react, to people and your environment. I can also recommend my favorite supplements and herbs for stress management in the description below.

Remember, the real opposite of testosterone isn’t estrogen—it’s cortisol.

And most people today are swimming in cortisol all day long.

5. Use the Right Supplements

Most of us are deficient in key nutrients.

And while 95% of testosterone-boosting supplements are ineffective, a few do work—if taken in the right dosage and form.

I’ve personally used natural testosterone booster for over 20 years – it’s safe, effective, and clinically proven to work.

6. Get Sexually Aroused More Often

Sexual arousal quickly boosts testosterone and dopamine. It can nearly double levels in minutes.

If you can’t get aroused, it’s likely because your testosterone is already low—this creates a negative spiral.

Follow everything in this video to break that cycle. Use your imagination, and remember: use it or lose it.

7. The Easiest Method? Subscribe

Okay, I’m joking a bit — but seriously, I do have a lot of great articles that dive deeper into testosterone optimization. It’s free for my readers and subscribers.

Don’t just listen—take action.

Start with one or two of these methods today. You don’t have to do everything all at once, but you must start.

Testosterone won’t rise on its own. Aging and life stress will only make things worse.

Take control now—your body, your partner, and your future will thank you. I promise you’ll look, feel, and perform better.

You’ll only wish you started sooner.

title: ☝️ Increase Your Free Testosterone - 3 Best Ways In 2025
content:
It’s 2025 now and today’s topic is: How do you increase your free testosterone levels?

Most blood tests measure total testosterone, but the more important marker is your free testosterone.

Think of it like this: Total testosterone is your gross income, while free testosterone is your net profit—what’s left after taxes and expenses. Free testosterone is what delivers the majority of testosterone’s health and performance benefits.

What Impacts Free Testosterone?

Sex Hormone Binding Globulin (SHBG)

One of the biggest factors impacting your free testosterone is a protein called Sex Hormone Binding Globulin (SHBG).

As SHBG levels rise, free testosterone levels drop. Unfortunately, SHBG increases as you age, gain fat, or deal with stress.

Factors That Raise SHBG

Decreased growth hormone

Poor liver function (due to aging, alcohol, medications)

Elevated cortisol and stress hormones

Very low-carb diets like keto or carnivore can lower free testosterone by increasing SHBG.

While total testosterone might appear higher on paper, free testosterone usually drops. That’s not what you want.

Step 1: Lower Estrogen to Reduce SHBG

Elevated estrogen increases SHBG and reduces free testosterone. As men age or gain body fat, estrogen often rises, throwing off the testosterone-to-estrogen ratio.

How to Lower Estrogen Naturally

Lose excess body fat: Fat cells produce more aromatase, the enzyme that converts testosterone into estrogen.

Use natural aromatase inhibitors: These block the aromatase enzyme and reduce estrogen conversion without crashing your levels.

Top Natural Aromatase Inhibitors

White button mushroom extract – 400mg/day (must be extract, not raw powder)

These aren’t as strong as prescription drugs like Arimidex or Letrozole, but that’s a good thing—you want to lower estrogen just slightly, not eliminate it.

Step 2: Use Herbs That Boost Free Testosterone

Some herbs can increase total testosterone while simultaneously reducing estrogen and SHBG, leading to higher free testosterone.

Top Testosterone-Boosting Herbs

Horny Goat Weed Extract

Important: Always use standardized extracts—not raw powder. The raw root is typically ineffective.

A Convenient Solution

It contains all of the ingredients mentioned above, including natural aromatase inhibitors and testosterone boosters.

Both liver and thyroid health influence your SHBG and hormone balance. Here’s what to do:

Step 4: Manage Stress & Cortisol

Chronic stress increases cortisol, which drives up SHBG and reduces free testosterone. You can reduce cortisol by:

I can recommend Stress Cortisol Relief – which is what I use – it’s safe, effective, and proven to work.

If you want to increase your free testosterone levels, focus on these 3 key areas:

Take herbal extracts that boost testosterone and reduce aromatase
