title: 🍌🧠 Erectile Dysfunction Hidden In Your Brain In 2025
content:
Have you ever had a problem getting an erection when it was time to have sex?

Do you feel insecure about it?

Do you worry about it or get anxious, which makes it even harder to get an erection?

Has it caused you NOT to want to have sex or get into a relationship?

Do you consider yourself a “nice guy”?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then keep reading because you’re not alone.

I’ll talk about one of the HIDDEN causes of erectile problems that most people don’t talk about and guys wouldn’t admit to.

But, more on that in a minute.

First, let’s talk about the 3 types of erections:

reflexive (associated with physical stimulation)

psychogenic (from visual or mental images)

and nocturnal (occurs during sleep)

Most of you know and have seen “morning wood” when you wake up with an erection. And if you don’t, it could be a sign of low testosterone and/or poor blood flow.

Granted, you get these “nocturnal” erections in the middle of the night when you’re sleeping and you aren’t aware of them, unlike the morning one when you see it.

The next obvious cause of an erection is physical touch. Again, if you aren’t able to get or maintain an erection with physical touch, this is primarily due to hormonal imbalance, such as low testosterone and secondarily, poor blood flow.

But, what if you can’t get an erection when trying to have sex, but you have no problem getting erections when masturbating?

This form of erectile dysfunction is more related to psychological reasons and thus, psychological impotence.

This would include stress, anxiety, depression, guilt, low self-esteem, and relationship issues.

And that’s what I’m going to focus on today – your mind, which is super powerful at causing erections and having orgasms.

And before I start, know that optimizing testosterone and other sex hormones will definitely improve psychological causes of impotence, in addition to the physical causes.

I’ll share with you the best testosterone-optimizing tactics.

But, let me first start with a personal story…

Anxiety & Sexual Performance

Many men who have psychological erectile problems do so because of anxiety and worry.

You are overthinking the situation and can’t stay in the moment.

This is even worse these days when people have more ADHD and overly stimulated brains and have become dopamine-resistant.

You start to think about all sorts of stupid things:

Am I doing this correctly

Past performance issues

Her sexual history – less history, more mystery

If you’re under stress because of work or money or something else, you might start thinking about that stuff and again, your mind goes somewhere else.

You start feeling insecure for a variety of reasons:

Are you going to last long enough?

And the more you think about this stuff, the worse things get. You start to obsess over it.

Like the person who has insomnia and the more they think about it, the more awake they become.

And the reason your penis stops working is because your mind sends out stress signals, releasing stress hormones such as adrenaline and cortisol.

These are “fight or flight” hormones, not relax and have sex hormones.

These are survival hormones, not let’s make a baby hormone.

These hormones send more blood to your muscles so you can run and get away and less to the penis to have sex.

In fact, this is why taking stimulants such as Adderall, ephedrine, many ADHD drugs, cocaine, and yes – even caffeine, causes erectile problems.

These “uppers” cause your penis to shrink inward. Like a scared turtle. Or when your penis is in cold water.

Ironically, the increase in dopamine with such stimulants may increase your DESIRE to have sex, but they can prevent your ability to get an erection.

So, what’s the solution?…

I’ll get to that in a minute.

Percentage Of Men Affected By Psychological Impotence

But first…, if any of this makes sense to you or you have felt such situations, just know that you are NOT alone.

Studies show that 25% or more of men are affected by this. The number might be higher since men are too embarrassed to admit to it.

Also, younger men who have fewer sexual experiences, tend to have more psychological erectile problems.

While older men over the age of 40, tend to have more physical erectile problems due to hormonal imbalances and aging.

How Do You Know If It’s Psychological Or Physical Impotence?

Physical causes of erectile dysfunction are typically due to:

Hormonal imbalances, such as low testosterone and/or high estrogen levels.

Poor blood flow is another reason, which is linked to diabetes, high blood pressure, cholesterol, obesity, and so forth.

Many drugs can also cause it – such as those for prostate, hair loss, blood pressure, cholesterol, sleep, anxiety and depression.

Then there are street drugs such as alcohol, marijuana, uppers, downers and so forth.

As you can see, there are lots of factors that can cause physical erectile problems.

However, how do you know if something is linked to psychological reasons?

Can you say “yes” to the following:

Do you get morning erections?

Can you get erections when you masturbate?

Are you under extra stress – work, relationships, money, etc.?

Are you dealing with extra anxiety or feeling sad or depressed?

Do you get nervous about pleasing your partner?

Do you feel insecure when it comes to having sex or sexual performance?

If you say yes to one and certainly more than one of these situations, then you might also be dealing with psychological issues causing your erectile problems.

If you’re dealing with stress and/or anxiety about something, sex is probably the last thing on your mind.

If you’ve been feeling down or hopeless or lost or somewhat depressed for a while, you don’t want to have sex.

And this can also be linked to hormonal and neurological imbalances, such as dopamine and serotonin.

These days, we have overstimulated dopamine, and thus, the receptors are somewhat “saturated” and less responsive.

So, you feel “blah” and unmotivated and not driven.

That lack of dopamine sensitivity causes a lack of drive and thus, you don’t want to pursue sex.

If you’re in a relationship and things aren’t going well… you’re arguing a lot… you feel like you’re not “good enough”… you feel depleted… criticized… and so forth, all of this is a turn-off.

You probably have some resentment or anger.

Worst of all, you might just be completely apathetic, and thus, you don’t care.

Again, no need or desire to perform sexually.

Porn Dependency / Addiction

Porn has become a big problem these days for guys.

If you’re watching porn all the time and that’s the way your brain and body gets an erection… You might get anxiety or “stage fright” when it comes to an actual human sexual performance.

When you watch porn, you’re in control. You pick and choose what you want to watch, you can fast-forward, skip and so forth.

You watch only what you want and when you want.

This is NOT how reality is and thus, you get anxiety and can’t perform.

Or your sense of reality is fake since you’re mainly watching fake porn.

The other problem is porn can make a guy feel insecure since most porn actors have above-average penis size. They seem to get hard in seconds, stay erect as long as they want, and then orgasm on command.

You then start to compare yourself to such people and that’s a really bad idea.

These guys are the best of the best.

You don’t compare yourself to Michael Jordan when you play basketball or Einstein when you’re learning something…. Right? … You know better. You know it’s not realistic.

YET, if all you do is watch big dicked porn guys, you start to feel very insecure about yourself.

This causes performance anxiety.

I have an entire course on how to grow your penis if you’re interested. It’s free and the link is below in the description area.

Lots of people, due to their upbringing, culture, or religion feel guilt around sex. Many times it’s subconscious and you don’t even realize it.

So, feeling guilty about the topic of sex can cause psychological erectile problems.

Lastly, having low self-esteem for a variety of reasons is a big underlying cause of psychological erectile problems.

Maybe you feel like you’re not good enough, big enough, rich enough, good-looking, smart, and so forth.

Or you lack sexual experience.

All of these things cause you to overanalyze the situation, and not be in the moment and then stress hormones go up, blood flow decreases, penis shrinks and now you start to panic and become compulsive about and from that point onward, things only get worse!

Okay, so now you know all the potential causes and reasons for having psychological erectile problems.

But, what’s the solution?

Well, it depends on YOUR specific situation. It depends on what factor or factors that are causing the psychological problems specifically for YOU!

Let’s talk about some of the different scenarios you might be dealing with.

And before I start, remember – if you optimize your hormones and increase your testosterone levels, your psychology and mindset ALSO improve.

ONE important thing I’ve realized is that many psychological issues in men are linked to being a “nice guy”.

Yes, this is something I had to deal with personally for many years. In fact, most of my 20’s and 30’s.

I almost hate myself for it and have so much regret. And I don’t want this to happen to YOU.

I know a lot of guys don’t feel good about the size of their penis. Especially when you watch a lot of porn.

Then you hear women saying how they like big dicks or that a guy has to be at least 6 or 7 inches or more.

I have so many of these stories myself that maybe I’ll share them with you in a later video or probably on a private membership site for us guys.

But the first thing is, that women don’t know how to measure. They’re so lame. So, forget what they say.

As far as porn, as I said earlier, these guys a doing porn BECAUSE they have large dicks. So, stop comparing yourself to them. It’s totally unrealistic.

Again, I made a detailed guide about improving your penis size and hardness.

If you’re dealing with stress, whatever it is, if there’s something you can do about it, great – then do it.

If you can’t, then stop focusing on it.

95% of your time should be spent on SOLUTIONS, not problems.

Most unsuccessful people do the opposite, they focus the majority of their time and energy on the problem.

If you’re not happy in your current relationship, first see what YOU can do to make improvements. What are YOU doing that’s hurting your relationship? Maybe get therapy.

Speak to your partner about whatever the issue is and if they don’t respond favorably, then move on.

Don’t blame, just share.

IF they criticize and don’t empathize, forget about it.

Life is too short to be in a miserable relationship.

If you watch a lot of porn, reduce it. Maybe just take a break from it for a week or a month. It does cause problems, especially in younger guys.

If you feel insecure about your lack of experience or ability to satisfy sexually, ask for guidance from your partner.

Stop trying to figure it out. Just ask how you can please them and do it.

Each girl is different, but they all want to be given to and listened.

If you’re feeling down or depressed or feeling sorry for yourself, STOP IT.

Whatever it is, you’re making it way worse in your head than it is in reality.

TRUST ME, I did this for many years.

I look back now and think what an idiot I was. It was all in my head.

Just remember, “This too shall pass”.

Have an “attitude of gratitude”.

Stop focusing on yourself or blaming others.

Whatever you are or wherever you are, you can be better and that’s all you can do.

Compare yourself to NOBODY.

Only compare you to yourself from before.

Get inspired and learn from others and then apply that to YOU and YOUR life and achieve YOUR goals.

With enough hard work, patience, persistence, and a positive attitude, you can achieve amazing things.

Have long-term goals and look at them daily.

title: This Hormone KILLS Testosterone & Libido - Insights For 2025
content:
Today, we will discuss how stress, or scientifically, cortisol hormone, can affect testosterone levels, libido, and muscle mass, and even cause weight gain.

As a side note: stress hormones such as cortisol accelerate aging and are linked to numerous health problems (blood sugar, blood pressure, poor sleep, depression, etc.)

Cortisol vs. Testosterone: The Battle Within

When you experience stress, your body releases the stress hormone cortisol, which can negatively affect your testosterone levels.

Despite what you might think, cortisol, not estrogen, is the real enemy of testosterone.

High levels of cortisol, can cause your body to go into survival mode, which can suppress processes such as muscle building and libido.

Stress & Its Effects on Your Body

Stress is not only a feeling of tension, but it also has physical and mental effects that can disrupt hormone balance and overall health.

Interestingly, men generally handle stress better than women because the higher testosterone levels help offset the negative effects of cortisol.

However, this can change with age, lifestyle, and continuous exposure to stress.

Steroids, Muscle, and Cortisol

Exploring the world of steroids gives us insight into how testosterone and cortisol interact.

Steroids, essentially synthetic testosterone, help counteract cortisol’s muscle-wasting effects, allowing for more extended, more intense workouts and better muscle preservation.

Managing Cortisol Hormone for Better Health

I’ve personally experienced the negative impacts of high cortisol, which led me to create a product called Stress & Cortisol Relief.

It helped me manage my stress levels and improve my overall health, including better sleep and more balanced hormone levels.

Tips for Lowering Stress Hormone

To manage cortisol and stress, consider your lifestyle choices.

Proper sleep, exercise moderation, and managing emotional and physical stressors are crucial.

In fact, deep quality sleep makes a big improvement in stress levels. Ironically, as cortisol levels go up, melatonin – the sleep hormone – goes DOWN.

So, stress causes sleep issues, which cause even high cortisol levels.

Natural supplements can help, especially if natural methods aren’t enough to lower your stress.

I often take Stress & Cortisol Relief, especially in the evenings, to help reduce cortisol levels and promote better sleep.

Managing stress and cortisol can indirectly boost your testosterone and improve various health aspects, from mood to sexual performance.

It is crucial to manage stress and cortisol levels to maintain healthy testosterone levels and overall well-being.

Simply taking supplements won’t be enough; it’s important to lead a balanced lifestyle that promotes long-term health.

If you’re struggling with stress, try natural and supplemental methods to keep cortisol in check and testosterone balanced.

Unfortunately, they take lots of time & effort and most people want faster results, with less effort... (especially with stress!)

title: 🛏️ Morning Wood / Erections Is A Major Warning Sign Of...
content:
I get a lot of questions about morning erections or morning wood as some guys call it.

Medically it’s called “nocturnal penile tumescense” or NPT for short.

So today you’ll discover:

What Causes Morning Erections

What Does Morning Wood Mean – Good & Bad

Warnings About Morning Wood

Causes of NOT Getting Morning Erections

How To Increase Morning Wood & Improve Your Erections

What Causes Morning Erections?

There are a variety of reasons you would get morning wood. Here are the top 5 most probable ones.

Parasympathetic Nervous System:

This part of your nervous system takes control while you sleep, especially during REM sleep, the stage where you dream. This can trigger erections.

REM sleep typically happens near the morning hours, which is why you may also get the morning wood.

Your testosterone levels are highest in the morning, right after waking up from REM sleep. This hormone spike can cause an erection, even without physical stimulation.

This also explains why when you’re younger, you’d get random erections, sometimes at embarrassing places – maybe in the pool swimming or somewhere else that isn’t appropriate.

A massive spike in testosterone, which happens in the morning, can cause this non-stimulatory erection.

A full bladder might press on a nerve that triggers your parasympathetic system, leading to an erection.

This also makes sense when you think about it since the morning is when most guys, have to urinate the most.

During the day, your body releases hormones to suppress erections. These are mainly norepinephrine and epinephrine (also known as adrenaline).

These hormones are part of the sympathetic nervous system, which is active when you are awake and alert.

Remember, this is the opposite of the parasympathetic system I mentioned earlier that can cause erections while sleeping.

Adrenalin work to constrict blood vessels, making them smaller, less blood flow, and so forth … including those in the penis, making it less likely for an erection to occur.

This also happens when you get nervous before sex. Your adrenalin shoots up, stress hormones such as cortisol increase, your body gets tense and the blood goes AWAY from the penis.

Anyway, the point is at night, especially during REM sleep, the activity of the sympathetic nervous system decreases, and the parasympathetic nervous system takes over. This shift allows for relaxation of the blood vessels and an increase in blood flow to the penis, which can lead to nocturnal erections.

Physical Stimulation:

Even if you’re asleep, your body can still respond to touch and thus, an erection can happen. If your genitals are touched, it may cause an erection.

If your genitals rub against something – such as the mattress or sheets or whatever… That slight stimulation, coupled with everything else I’ve mentioned, can cause an erection while you’re sleeping.

What Does Morning Wood Mean?

Morning wood is a normal and healthy part of sleep. It means that the penile tissue, blood, and nervous system are in good condition, working properly, and are healthy.

Now, I mention MORNING erections since that’s the one most guys will notice when they wake up.

However, that’s not the only time you get erections while sleeping.

As stated earlier, Nocturnal penile tumescence (NPT), also known as sleep-related erections, usually occurs 3–5 times during an 8-hour sleep period.

These erections can last more than 30 minutes and sometimes up to 2 hours.

NPT is more common in younger men because they have higher testosterone levels, and can occur every morning and multiple times during the night.

As men age into their 40s and 50s, they may experience fewer NPT episodes due to a decline in testosterone.

What’s important to note is that these NPT erections contribute to penile health.

In some way, the penis is like a muscle – the more often it pumps up and the bigger the pump, the healthier the muscle and in this case, the penis.

As the saying goes, “use it or lose it”.

This is why pumping and penis exercises can also help improve erections.

Lack Of Morning Wood = Serious Health Problems?

Sadly, the less often you get these erections, the less healthy you are.

In fact, the research shows that the lack of erections, more specifically, the morning wood and NPT, is a warning sign of potential heart problems.

This means poor blood flow to the heart AND brain.

This could be plaque buildup.

Or high blood pressure or blood sugar levels.

It is also an indicator of low testosterone and poor hormonal balance.

And I’ll get to solutions about this in a minute.

Warnings About Morning Wood

As we’ve learned today, morning wood and NPT is necessary and important for your health, including penis health.

So, what if you’re NOT getting these morning erections? Like you used to? Not as often? Or worse yet, AT ALL?

Maybe it happens once a week or a month?

Well, as stated, this is really bad warning sign that something is wrong.

But, what’s the cause of this?

What’s “broken” in your body?

And more importantly, how can we fix it?

Causes Of NOT Getting Morning Erections

Not getting morning erections, also known as a reduction in or absence of nocturnal erections, can be a sign of various underlying health problems. Here are the top 7:

1. Erectile Dysfunction (ED):

Vascular Issues: Conditions like atherosclerosis (narrowing of blood vessels) can reduce blood flow to the penis.

Neurological Problems: Damage to the nerves that control erections, due to conditions like diabetes or spinal cord injuries.

2. Hormonal Imbalances:

Low Testosterone Levels: Testosterone plays a key role in sexual function. Low levels, often due to aging, hypogonadism, hormonal imbalances, or lack of specific nutrients.

Increased “Female” Hormones: Elevated levels of prolactin and estrogen, will reduce testosterone and reduce the refractory period and your ability to get erections.

Increases in Stress Hormones: Earlier I mentioned how an increase in adrenaline will reduce blood flow. As this stress hormone increases, so will cortisol, which will then decrease testosterone levels.

3. Psychological Factors:

Stress and Anxiety: Chronic stress or anxiety can affect your sexual function, including morning erections.

Depression: Depression can lower libido and affect the frequency of nocturnal erections.

Antidepressants: Some medications, especially selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), can interfere with sexual function and reduce the occurrence of morning erections. These are popular drugs such as Prozac.

Blood Pressure Medications: Certain antihypertensives can also impact erectile function.

Hair Loss & Prostate Medications: Drugs used for hair loss and prostate growth, such as 5-alpha reductase inhibitors like Finasteride (Proscar & Propecia) will your ability to get and maintain erections.

Sleep Medications: Many drugs, including those that are over the counter that are used for sleep, will reduce your erections.

Actually, there are a lot of drugs that cause erectile problems.

5. Lifestyle Factors:

Poor Sleep Quality: Sleep disorders like sleep apnea or chronic sleep deprivation can interfere with REM sleep, where morning erections are most likely to occur. Poor sleep also causes numerous hormonal imbalances, such as a decrease in testosterone levels, while increasing cortisol levels.

Excessive Alcohol Consumption: Alcohol can impair sexual function, and chronic use can lead to a decrease in morning erections.

Smoking: Smoking can damage blood vessels and restrict blood flow, reducing the likelihood of morning erections.

Natural Aging: As men age, the frequency and intensity of morning erections may decrease due to changes in blood flow, nerve function, and hormone levels.

7. Underlying Medical Conditions:

Diabetes: High blood sugar levels can damage nerves and blood vessels, leading to a reduction in morning erections.

Cardiovascular Disease: Conditions affecting heart and blood vessel health can impact the ability to have morning erections.

Obesity: Excess weight can contribute to hormonal imbalances and vascular issues, both of which can reduce morning erections.

How To Increase Morning Wood & Improve Erections

Now we are near the end of today’s topic, and the part most of you care about is how to increase morning wood and improve the quality of your erections.

First, you need to stop doing all the negative things that I mentioned, such as:

Changing your medications for alternatives that don’t cause these problems.

Lowering your stress levels

Limiting or eliminating alcohol, smoking, marijuana, and other “street” drugs.

Finally, you need to increase your testosterone levels.

Personally, when I take certain herbs that increase testosterone, the first week I notice I’m getting a ton of erections every time I get up to pee in the middle of the night or when I wake up in the morning.

These are crazy rock-hard, won’t go away kind.

It’s awesome and makes me feel super young again.

But, after a week or two, my body adapts and the erections aren’t as awesome.

However, they are still way better than before I took the supplements to boost my testosterone levels.

The other thing you need to do is improve your blood flow.

Again, I’ve made videos about this, in addition to supplements you can take that’ll quickly help increase circulation throughout your body – heart, brain, muscles, and yes, your penis.

Take action, and fix this situation because as stated in the very beginning – lack of morning wood and poor erection quality a major warning sign of poor health – for your heart and brain.

title: What REALLY Causes Erectile Problems? ( 2025 update)
content:
Today’s question is from Patrick and he asks

“What causes erectile problems and impotence? Why haven’t scientists found one permanent cure for this?”

This is a good question and yeah, you’d think there would be a cure for this by now … just like hair loss or other health issues. But what causes arousal in people, men and especially women… is very complicated and thus, there is never going to be ONE solution because there usually isn’t ONE cause.

HOWEVER, over the past 20+ years, I’ve seen a common denominator and primary cause … and that has to do with hormonal imbalances.

As men age, their testosterone begins to decline… starting as early as in his mid 20’s. By age 40, you barely make half of what you used to in your 20’s, and obviously, it only gets worse as you get older.

What’s important to know is that testosterone is the PRIMARY hormone that controls sex drive, libido and erections… BOTH physically and emotionally! And this is because testosterone interacts with OTHER key “sex” hormones such as:

Dihydrotestosterone (DHT)

Dopamine and other neurotransmitters in your brain

Is It All In Your “Head”?…

However, there are other factors that ALSO contribute to low libido and erection problems. One of them is your MIND! If you’re under stress — either physical or emotional, that’ll cause problems.

And what’s interesting is that “stress” causes a DECREASE in your testosterone levels and an increase in your “stress” hormone, cortisol. Again, a HORMONAL issue.

Another cause is if you’re overweight and eat a lot of junk foods, smoke (marijuana or cigarettes), and drink alcohol. And the reason for this is because FAT cells produce more estrogen, as does smoking pot and drinking alcohol.

As estrogen increases, testosterone DROPS! Again, a HORMONAL issue.

Prescription Drugs & Erectile Problems…

Another major cause is if you take prescription medications — for cholesterol, blood pressure, stomach acid, blood thinners, prostate, etc., etc.

ALL of these drugs cause lowered libido and impotency because, yes… you guessed it — HORMONAL changes.

Even drugs such as Viagra and Cialis don’t work very well IF your testosterone is too low. In fact, they work MUCH better if your testosterone and hormone levels are optimal.

Don’t Worry, You’re Not Alone…

My background is in anti-aging and Endocrinology, which is the study of hormones. So I’m extremely familiar with this topic and very passionate about it because I want to look and feel young, just like everyone else. And hormonal balance is the secret!

I’ve helped hundreds and thousands of men over the past 20 years fix this area of their life, naturally and permanently… simply by optimizing their “youth” hormones.

So, don’t worry… You’re not alone, there’s hope and natural solutions.

title: ❗ Penis Size Discovery At Nude Beach Visit In 2025
content:
I wasn’t planning on making this video in 2025, but I had an interesting experience recently that I think is worth sharing.

It’s one of those “once in a lifetime” things that ended up teaching me some surprising lessons, especially on a topic I know many of you are curious about penis size, performance, and body image. So let’s dive into it.

The Accidental Nude Beach Experience

A few weeks ago, I went paragliding in San Diego—great views, and lots of fun, but I ended up feeling a bit seasick while soaring through the sky.

After landing, my friend suggested we take a walk, and, by chance, we stumbled upon a nude beach.

Now, let me tell you, this wasn’t exactly on the itinerary! But, curiosity got the better of us, so we decided to check it out.

As soon as we got there, all sorts of thoughts started racing through my head.

You know, as guys, we tend to size ourselves up, comparing ourselves to others—especially when it comes to things like penis size.

This is a topic I get tons of questions about, and I’ve even created an entire free email course on increasing penis size, and girth and achieving harder, fuller erections.

The Reality of Penis Size

Here’s the thing: most of us, whether we admit it or not, have at some point worried about our penis size.

And unfortunately, a lot of that stress comes from comparing ourselves to unrealistic standards, especially those set by porn. What I saw at the beach was eye-opening.

In reality, most men are “normal” size or even smaller than you might expect. And guess what?

No one there was in perfect shape.

It’s like comparing yourself to Arnold Schwarzenegger in his prime or a top-level bodybuilder like Chris Bumstead—most of us will never look like that, no matter how hard we train.

The same goes for penis size in porn. Porn stars are handpicked for their genetics, just like athletes, and comparing yourself to them is setting yourself up for disappointment.

Some Interesting Observations

One of the more unexpected things I noticed was the difference in body proportions.

Some guys with smaller penises had noticeably large testicles, which sparked a little theory in my mind.

I wondered if maybe their testosterone levels weren’t optimal, and their testicles were compensating by producing more testosterone.

It’s a bit of a “Dr. Sam theory,” but it made me think about how the body balances hormones. There’s no scientific proof behind this, but it’s interesting to consider how testosterone, size, and performance might be interconnected.

Another thing that stood out was how many of the guys weren’t “showers,” meaning they didn’t appear very large when flaccid.

Some might be “growers,” where their size increases significantly when erect, while others might just have small penises, period.

But here’s the key takeaway: nobody cared.

The idea that you need to have a giant penis to feel confident or attractive is a myth. You don’t need to be a porn star to feel good about yourself.

Tips for Feeling Confident (Manscaping and More)

Something else I noticed at the beach was how many guys had lots of pubic hair, which can actually make your penis look smaller.

A simple tip I always recommend is manscaping—trimming that hair can make a big difference in how large you appear.

It’s a quick and easy way to boost your confidence, and I have a video on that too.

Why Some Guys Seemed Bigger

There were two guys at the beach who were notably larger than the others, and I noticed something interesting—they kept pulling on their penises.

This reminded me of a technique I talked about in my email course called jelqing, which involves stretching and massaging the penis to potentially increase size over time.

It’s not a quick fix, but it’s a method some people swear by. Seeing these guys consistently “pulling” made me wonder if they were using similar techniques to enhance their size.

My Personal Nude Beach Experience

Now, I didn’t plan to get naked at the beach, but, well…nature called!

I needed to use the bathroom badly, and there were no facilities nearby.

My date suggested I go into the ocean, and after a moment of hesitation, I stripped down and dove in.

It was my first time going fully nude in public, and while it was a bit nerve-wracking at first, I realized something important—nobody cared.

There was no judgment, no weird looks.

It was a liberating experience and a reminder that most of the insecurities we hold onto are just in our heads.

Conclusion: Confidence Over Comparison

The biggest takeaway from my accidental nude beach trip is this: stop comparing yourself to unrealistic standards.

Whether it’s porn, professional athletes, or celebrities, these comparisons are harmful and unnecessary.

In reality, most people are just like you—average and normal.

The key is to feel confident in your own skin and focus on what you can improve for yourself, not based on others.

For those of you still curious about improving your penis size, performance, or overall confidence, I’ve got links to my free email course, which covers techniques like jelqing, increasing girth, and more.

But remember, confidence comes from within, not from how you measure up to others.

What Are Kegel Exercises?

Kegels are exercises most people associate with women after giving birth. However, men can benefit from these too.

They’re designed to strengthen your perineal muscles, which sit between your anus and testicles.

This area plays a crucial role in erections, ejaculation, and prostate function.

Strengthening it can give you more control over your erections, help you last longer, and even make your orgasms more intense.

How Do Kegels Work for Erections?

Doing Kegel exercises correctly engages the perineal muscle, which you use without even realizing it.

For example, when you’re midstream while peeing and you stop the flow, you’re using that muscle.

Or when you’re holding in gas because you’re on a date and don’t want to embarrass yourself, that’s the same muscle at work.

But here’s the thing—just like with any other muscle, you need to exercise it consistently and correctly to get the full benefits.

Step-by-Step: How to Perform Kegel Exercises

Find the Muscle: Imagine stopping your pee mid-flow or holding in gas—this is the muscle you’ll focus on.

Contract: Squeeze the muscle and hold for 3-5 seconds.

Release: Relax the muscle for 1-2 seconds.

Repetitions: Repeat this process for 10-20 reps. That’s one set.

Start with one set, three times a week, like Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.

Over time, increase to two or three sets. As you build strength, you can even do Kegels five times a week.

But don’t overdo it—just like lifting weights, your muscles need rest to grow stronger.

title: ❗ Stress Causes Low Testosterone & Aging In
content:
Now it’s 2025 and up to now, I’ve written a lot of articles about how to increase your testosterone levels, so you can look and feel younger. So you can have a higher libido, fix erectile problems, gain more muscle, lose fat, and have higher energy levels.

However, today I want to write an article about one of the major causes that lower testosterone in the first place and that’s stress and worry

Stress = Low Testosterone

As a reminder, optimal testosterone levels have both physical AND psychological/emotional benefits.

In fact, one of the best “anti-depressants” in this world, is having higher testosterone levels.

And there’s a lot of new evidence showing how testosterone and anxious feelings interact with each other1,2… Specifically, they work in opposing ways.

Interestingly, this also affects women in the same way.3

It’s All About Your Hormones

To simplify everything and get right to the point,… when you are feeling anxious or have a panic attack… or you’re worrying a lot,… a lot of negative changes happen to your body – many having to do with your hormones, various chemicals, and neurotransmitters.

When your stress hormone cortisol goes up, your testosterone levels drop.4

This is because nature thinks you must be dealing with a lot of problems and this is NOT the time for you to procreate and have a baby. So, it shuts down your testosterone levels.

As your testosterone drops, your estrogen RATIO becomes more dominant. Thus, estrogen starts to take over… This further causes you more stress and “moodiness”.4,5

With worry and stress, your neurotransmitter Dopamine drops! …This causes a drop in your libido and will also cause an increase in your female hormone, prolactin. Which FURTHER drops your testosterone levels.6-8

Also, worry and stress, cause more adrenal production and that lowers another neurotransmitter called serotonin.9,10 Which causes depressive feelings and panic attacks, which just makes this entire process much worse.

And finally, stress and worry cause sleep problems and we all know how important sleep is for testosterone products, growth hormone release, and just overall health.

And all of these negative changes accelerate aging!

So what’s the point?… You need to BETTER manage your “state” of mind. Your THOUGHTS. Your BODY.

The Secret Is HOW You React

Now, you can’t always manage or eliminate stress. That’s just crazy and impossible.

However, you can and MUST manage how you REACT to stressful situations.

Your MIND is extremely powerful and what you focus on, expands. What you think about more, you’ll FEEL more.

So, don’t watch it just yet. … Because I want you to do yourself a big favor…

One of the biggest reasons people have CHRONIC stress and worry is that they mistakenly spend the majority of their time focusing on the PROBLEM… the “stressful” situation.

What You Focus On Expands

What you focus on expands and gets bigger. So if you’re spending time always focusing on the problem and having “negative dialog” in your head – your body is constantly going to feel stressed and anxious.

Instead, you need to spend your time on the SOLUTION!

I’m not saying pretend nothing bad has happened. Just don’t dwell on it. It’s not going to fix anything, right?

Most people make problems worse than they really are.

I’m telling you to just see it as it really is – a temporary setback, which is a part of life.

What’s interesting is that children freak out over the smallest things. The toy breaks and they think it’s the end of the world. They don’t know any better. They don’t know that they can just fix the toy or get a new one.

However, what’s really important is that children let things go quickly. While we adults don’t!

So as an adult, you have no reason to freak out when something bad happens because you know that “this too shall pass” and you’ve dealt with problems in the past and you always got through it, right?

However, like a child, you need to learn to let go and move “onward and upward”.

It’s all a state of mind.

Then, do something physical because “motion, creates emotion” and that will improve your hormones.

Take Herbs, Vitamins & Minerals

And finally, you can take special herbs, vitamins, and minerals during times of stress and worry, which will almost immediately rebalance your hormones back to optimal levels.

title: 🚏 Refractory Period: More Orgasms & Better Sex In 2025
content:
Before I continue, I want to let you know that the refractory period, hence the time or phase following your next orgasm, is totally normal and natural.

However, how LONG this “refractory period” lasts depends on a variety of factors, which is what I’m going to discuss, including solutions to improve and shorten the duration of the refractory period.

Causes Of Long Refractory Period

Let’s first discuss the 3 biggest causes of the poor and long refractory periods.

I know your time is valuable, so let’s start with the first and primary reason, which would be hormonal changes.

Before you have sex, you’re in a more “driven” mode.

Your goal is to have sex and hopefully have an orgasm.

This is fueled by dopamine, a neurotransmitter, and by one other super hormone, which I’ll tell you about in a minute.

Dopamine is referred to by some people as the “pleasure” chemical. Others will refer to it as the “pursuit” chemical.

So it makes sense dopamine is high because you are now in the pursuit of sex and the pleasure of having an orgasm.

Dopamine is associated with sexual arousal.

Now, after you have an orgasm, things change.

Dopamine drops dramatically, while another hormone called prolactin shoots up.

In fact, dopamine and prolactin typically work in opposite spectrums. As one goes up, the other comes down.

Thus, prolactin induces a feeling of sexual satisfaction and REDUCES arousal.

One thing to keep in mind is that both men and women… and pretty much all mammals… produce the same hormones. The main difference is ratio and amount.

For example, both men and women have testosterone and estrogen. However, men have a lot more testosterone than estrogen comparatively.

And prolactin is typically more of a female hormone. It goes up dramatically when women are breastfeeding. It’s required to produce milk.

In regards to men, high prolactin can also cause milk to come out of your nipples. This happens to some bodybuilders when taking certain drugs such as nandrolone.

And, if prolactin and estrogen are both higher in men, you get gynecomastia, also called “man boobs”.

One other negative effect of high prolactin is hair loss, which most doctors and so-called hair experts will not tell you because they don’t know.

In fact, this is seen in birds that are molting, which is the shedding of old feathers. And, this is triggered due to a high surge in prolactin.

One last thing, as prolactin and estrogen go up, testosterone typically will come down.

I mention all of this because if you think about it, it makes sense.

What happens as men get older?…

The refractory period increases and it takes them longer to get an erection and have orgasms

Their dopamine AND testosterone levels drop.

Estrogen typically rises, at least in ratio to testosterone.

They lose their hair.

They get fatty chests or man boobs or even gynecomastia in extreme cases.

Aren’t as horny and have a harder time getting erections.

Aren’t as driven in life… this, of course, includes sexual.

Anyway, I can go on and on… But, you get the point.

So, what’s the solution?

We want to increase dopamine and the superhormone I alluded to earlier, which is testosterone.

Yes, higher testosterone means more dopamine, which means higher libido, more drive, better erections, and yes, typically lower prolactin.

And how do we do this?…

I’ll talk about that in a minute because I also need to mention other causes of poor refectory period.

After your orgasm, your body’s nervous system shifts from a state of arousal to a more relaxed state. This will obviously reduce your body’s response to sexual stimulation.

Of course, higher testosterone will allow you to bounce back and recover faster.

We also can’t forget about your psychological and emotional state of mind. Stress, fatigue, and a lack of interest can extend the refractory period.

Remember how stimulated you get when you’re with someone new? That’s associated with higher testosterone and dopamine levels.

Unfortunately, over time, you get used to the same stimuli and thus, the same person or the same sexual act or the same type of porn will NO longer shoot up your dopamine levels… And hence, less excitement and sexual arousal.

As with everything, we always have to factor in genetics, age, and physical health. Some people genetically have a longer refractory period.

Aging, hormonal imbalances, and poor physical health will all contribute to a longer refractory period.

Now that we know the causes, let’s talk about the solutions for improving and shortening the refractory period.

Remember how earlier I said that the longer refractory period is caused by an increase in Prolactin? And how as prolactin goes up, dopamine levels come down?

Well, the opposite is true as well.

Thus, we want to increase your dopamine levels. We can do this naturally or with drugs.

For example, Parkinson’s drugs typically increase dopamine levels or increase your body’s receptor sensitivity to dopamine.

Why? … because people with Parkinson’s are lacking dopamine levels, among other neurological problems that go beyond the scope of today’s topic.

So, for almost 20 years, I’ve been taking a drug called Selegiline (suh-leg-juh-leen), also called Eldepryl or Deprenyl.

I’m not going about this drug today. However, if you want me to in future videos, please let me know.

There are other drugs that increase dopamine or are dopamine agonists. Such as bromocriptine or cabergoline. But, Selegiline is the safest in my opinion and has many anti-aging and cognitive benefits.

However, legal disclaimer – don’t listen to anything I say, always speak to your doctor before you do anything.

But, let’s first start with natural ways of improving dopamine levels.

One of the best is taking L-tyrosine – an amino acid. I take 500 mg, 2-3x daily. But, start with just 500 mg on an empty stomach in the morning.

It does give you energy, so don’t take it at night.

Also, taking Mucuna Pruriens Extract can help. Make suure it contain 25% L-Dopa extract. I take 200 mg daily.

This is found in AlphaViril, the testosterone-boosting, libido-enhancing, and erection-improving supplement I’ve been taking for over 20 years.

Which leads to the next topic and that is:

As stated already, increasing testosterone levels will help boost dopamine levels. And of course, so many other benefits associated with naturally high testosterone.

Of course, I’ve written so many articles about how to naturally increase testosterone and optimize your hormones, that I’m not going to do that in today’s article.

And yes, AlphaViril has numerous natural herbs and vitamins that help boost your testosterone levels.

This is why AlphaViril has been a best seller for over 20 years and my favorite supplement. Because it deals with the primary hormonal factors, that I’ve discussed today – testosterone estrogen, prolactin, dopamine, and others.

Stress: Stress and the rise in cortisol and adrenalin cause shrinkage too. Fight-or-flight causes vasoconstriction and lowered blood flow. Not only does the penis shrink during times of stress, it’s much more difficult to get an erection.

Masturbation & Abstinence

My penis is shrinking

Should I stop and “NoFap”

Thousands of guys are holding back, including even sex with women – thinking their testosterone levels will shoot up, by not shooting out.

I guess in “theory”, this might be true since you feel hornier when you hold back.

Some guys are also not ejaculating for weeks or even months for betterr fertility and ejaculatory volume.

Well, let’s get to some clinical studies…

Simply stated, there’s basically no real research showing that abstinence – thus, not having sex or masturbating – will increase testosterone levels.

In fact, the opposite is true.

Watching porn or engaging in sexual activities… and thus, anything that turns you on, can raise testosterone levels.

Additionally, there are studies showing that in older men and women, the more often you masturbate, the higher your testosterone levels.

Also, there are studies with men who have erectile dysfunction showing that low sexual activity is associated with low testosterone while resuming sexual activities restores testosterone levels.

Questionable Clinical Studies

The NoFap community will cite the occasional study that shows higher levels of testosterone when you don’t masturbate.

Unfortunately, the sample size is either really small… or the increase in testosterone is tiny … or the study couldn’t be replicated.

Some will report better mental health with abstinence.

However, on the flip side, many people will report better stress levels, happiness, and so forth with masturbation.

As I’ve stated in previous videos, if you want a natural and proven way to boost your testosterone levels, increase your sex drive, and get harder erections – then give your body the specific nutrients it needs to have your testicles produce more testosterone.

Abstinence & Sperm Quality

What about sperm quality from abstinence?

Well, a review of almost 30 studies concluded that abstinence and fertility outcomes are inconclusive.

A study did show an improvement in fertility from abstinence, but it plateaus after 3 days. So, don’t ejaculate for 3 days for a potentially better fertility outcome.

Now, there are studies showing that specific herbs such as Fadogia, Tribulus and a few others help increase fertility and sperm quality because they increase LH and FSH levels.

These and similar ingredients are found in AlphaViril – the testosterone booster supplement I’ve been using since 1999.

Masturbation & Ejaculatory Volume

And how about ejaculatory volume?

Yes, there’s an increase in volume with abstinence.

Studies show that every day you wait, you can increase volume by about 10%. However, this maxes out in a week.

Now, please keep in mind that this extra ejaculatory volume does NOT also mean 10% more sperm every day.

So, if you want to impress someone with more volume… In porn it’s called a “money shot”… I suggest you masturbate, but do NOT orgasm.

Does this every day, for about 2-3 days.

This creates an even bigger buildup in volume.

However, you’ll also cum a lot faster too because you’ve been holding back.

So, keep that in mind too…

Masturbation & Prostate Health

One last important topic and that has to do with your prostate.

Having orgasms is good for the prostate.

One reason the prostate grows as men get older is due to a lack of orgasms because guys aren’t as horny or can’t get erect and thus, not having sex or masturbating as often.

However, taking certain vitamins and minerals such as Vitamin D, zinc, copper, selenium and others all help promote prostate health.

Again, these are others are also found in AlphaViril.

NoFap, Abstinence & Suicide

Personally, I think abstinence and not masturbating is not natural, at least for me. We’ve been doing it since puberty.

There’s an interesting UCLA research showing that the men who were NoFaping and hence, were celibate… When they decided to stop being abstinent, about 30% of them had suicidal thoughts.

They felt anxiety, shame, and even depression… Especially when they participated in the NoFap online communities.

Obviously, masturbation can affect the physical and mental health of men. Being in such groups, and the peer pressure of the need to conform or belong to a group can make things much worse emotionally.

So, let’s quickly summarize what we’ve learned today.

Abstinence, not masturbating, not having orgasms, NoFap, and so forth don’t help increase testosterone levels.

For some men, abstinence can improve their mood, maybe give them more energy, better focus on life, and so forth – all of which are important.

Remember, the goal isn’t ONLY to increase your testosterone levels. It’s also free of testosterone. While balancing estrogen and DHT with your testosterone levels.

As for sperm quality – again, no improvement with abstinence.

Now, the ejaculatory volume does increase with abstinence, but only waiting up to 3 days. After that, no further improvements.

Prostate health goes down with abstinence. So, make sure you try to ejaculate at least 1-2x a week for better prostate health.

Now, it’s up to you whether you want to be abstinent, celibate, and practicing NoFap.

It’s your life and your body.

title: 🔽 Low Testosterone = 88% Higher Death Rate In 2025
content:
Testosterone is a crucial hormone in the male body, playing a vital role in various physiological processes.

Low testosterone levels, also known as hypogonadism, can have significant negative effects on men’s health, potentially leading to accelerated aging, premature death, and various health problems.

This article highlights the 5 primary negative health consequences of having low testosterone.

Accelerated Aging and Premature Death

Men with low testosterone levels may experience faster biological aging.

Studies have shown a correlation between low testosterone and increased mortality rates.

Lower testosterone levels can lead to decreased muscle mass, increased body fat, and reduced bone density, all contributing to aging.

A study published in the Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism found that men with low testosterone levels had a higher mortality rate compared to those with normal levels.

Low Testosterone & Cardiovascular Health

Low testosterone is associated with a higher risk of cardiovascular diseases.

Men with hypogonadism have an increased risk of developing conditions such as atherosclerosis and heart attacks.

Clinical studies suggest that increasing testosterone levels into the normal, healthy range can improve heart health in men with low testosterone.

Research in the Journal of the American College of Cardiology showed that men with low testosterone were more likely to suffer from cardiovascular events.

TRT was associated with a reduced risk of such events.

Metabolic Syndrome and Diabetes

Low testosterone levels are linked to metabolic syndrome, a cluster of conditions that increase the risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes.

Hypogonadal men are more likely to develop insulin resistance, which can lead to type 2 diabetes.

TRT has been shown to improve insulin sensitivity and reduce the risk of diabetes in men with low testosterone.

A study in Diabetes Care indicated that men with low testosterone levels had a higher prevalence of metabolic syndrome and insulin resistance.

TRT improved metabolic parameters in these men.

Mental Health and Cognitive Function

Testosterone plays a role in mood regulation and cognitive function.

Men with low testosterone levels are more prone to depression, anxiety, and cognitive decline.

Improving testosterone levels through TRT may enhance mood and cognitive abilities in affected men.

Findings from a study in The Aging Male suggested that testosterone supplementation in men with low levels improved mood and cognitive function, reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety.

Low Testosterone & Sexual Health

Testosterone is essential for maintaining libido and erectile function.

Low levels can lead to reduced sexual desire, erectile dysfunction, and infertility.

TRT can help restore sexual function and improve the quality of life for men with hypogonadism. By improving testosterone and sexual health, relationships and the bond between two people strengthen.

Improving sexual health also enhances confidence, self-esteem, and happiness.

Research in the Journal of Sexual Medicine demonstrated that TRT significantly improved sexual function and libido in men with hypogonadism.

Low testosterone levels can have a profound impact on men’s health, leading to accelerated aging, premature death, and various health issues. Addressing hypogonadism and improving testosterone levels naturally, can help mitigate these risks and improve overall quality of life.

What’s This Super Sex Vitamin?…

If you’ve been following me for a while and are subscribed to my channel, you’ve heard me talk about the sexiest MINERAL of all – which is ZINC.

But, when it comes to Vitamins, D is even sexier.

And most people don’t know, but vitamin D is not technically a vitamin, it’s actually a steroid hormone.

It has the same base structure of testosterone and estrogen – both being steroid molecules.

That’s why Vitamin D is so powerful.

Most People Are Deficient In This Vitamin

Over a decade ago, I did a blood test and noticed my Vitamin D levels were low. I was honestly very surprised since I was always outdoors.

I mention outdoors because sunlight is required for vitamin D production in your body. You can’t get much vitamin D from food.

And back then, I did take a multivitamin thinking that was enough, but it clearly wasn’t because they only contained the bare minimum amount.

Since then, I’ve seen hundreds of blood tests, and over and over again, I see sub-optimal levels of Vitamin D. Many times, even BELOW normal levels.

Again, I was very surprised since I live on the West Coast where it’s always nice and sunny.

So, just imagine how low vitamin D levels must be in places where it’s not as sunny?…

Especially these days because we are indoors most of the time.

Also, the production of vitamin D drops as you age, when you have higher body fat levels and the darker your skin.

This is why we need to supplement extra Vitamin D.

Not Just Normal – But Optimal Levels

When I do a blood test, I try to keep my levels on the higher end, over 70 ng/mL.

There’s no toxicity to vitamin D. But the minimum your blood test should be is 50 ng/mL

Remember, the goal is not “normal” levels, but OPTIMAL levels.

I personally take 5000 units / 125 mcg of Vitamin D3 daily in the summer and double that in the winter, at 10,000 units/250 mcg.

Again, a blood test will give your best requirements.

You should also take Vitamin D3 with Vitamin K2 to help improve absorption into the bones where it should be, rather than the arteries where it can go if you take too much Vitamin D by itself.

I take Perfect Vitamin D3 + K2 because it has the correct ratio.

Most importantly, unlike other Vitamin D sources where it’s in a cheaper, oil-based form derived from bodily fluids secreted by sheep’s glands and wool… which is not cool.

Perfect Vitamin D3 is 100% plant-based. It’s micro-encapsulated for 2x improved absorbability and freshness when compared to the usual, cheaper oil-based Vitamin D on the market.

This is a very low-cost, high-value, and essential supplement for all people, especially men.

A bottle of Perfect Vitamin DK lasts 3 months, which is less than 25 cents daily. Just one quarter a day dramatically improves your health, fitness & longevity… And your manhood.

Try it and let me know how it works for you…

Important "Increase Your Vitamin D+K" Shortcut

There are literally dozens of health benefits when improving your Vitamin D levels ... However, there are two big problems:

Problem #1: About 93% of people are deficient or sub-optimal levels of Vitamin D

Problem #2: Primary way to get Vit D is from 45-60 min of daily sunlight daily (your entire body, not just face or hands)

This is why its best to take a daily supplement to ensure you have healthy & optimal Vit D levels.

And make sure you take Vit D3 with K2 to ensure proper absorption and calcium metabolism for brain & heart health.

title: ❗30 Years Of TRT Experience In 2025 - Doctor Reveals!
content:
Hey guys, Dr. Sam Robbins here, and today I’m diving deep into TRT, or Testosterone Replacement Therapy.

There’s a lot of misinformation floating around, so I’m here to set the record straight and share my expertise on this subject.

As someone who’s been in this field for quite some time, I’ve seen the good, the bad, and the ugly when it comes to TRT. So, let’s get started.

What Is Testosterone?

Testosterone is a crucial hormone that both men and women produce.

Men primarily produce it in the testicles, while women produce it in smaller amounts in the ovaries and adrenal glands.

Testosterone plays a key role in various bodily functions, including muscle mass, bone density, and sex drive.

As we age, testosterone levels naturally decline, which can lead to a host of symptoms.

The Misconceptions About TRT

Many doctors and TRT clinics are prescribing testosterone incorrectly.

They either overdo it or underdo certain aspects, leading to numerous side effects and unnecessary costs.

TRT is not a magical solution that will transform you into a superhuman overnight.

There are myths and misconceptions about its benefits that need to be addressed.

What TRT Won’t Do for You

Instant Muscles: TRT alone won’t give you the physique of a bodybuilder without proper diet and exercise.

Fix All Health Issues: It’s not a cure-all for problems like poor sleep, high blood pressure, or cholesterol issues.

Eternal Youth: TRT can’t reverse aging. It helps manage some symptoms of low testosterone but doesn’t turn back the clock.

There are specific scenarios where TRT is not recommended:

Lack of Symptoms: If you don’t have significant symptoms of low testosterone, TRT might not be necessary.

Fertility Concerns: TRT can affect fertility by reducing sperm production.

Genetic Predispositions: Those prone to hair loss, gynecomastia, or prostate issues may find these problems exacerbated by TRT.

TRT can have several side effects, especially if not managed correctly:

Hair Loss: Increased testosterone can accelerate hair loss in genetically predisposed individuals.

Prostate Issues: There’s a risk of prostate enlargement or cancer.

Mood Swings: TRT can cause emotional fluctuations, including aggression or depression.

Skin Issues: Acne and oily skin can become problems.

Cardiovascular Risks: Blood pressure and cholesterol levels can be negatively affected.

If you decide to proceed with TRT, it’s crucial to find a knowledgeable doctor and use the correct forms and dosages:

Injections: The most common form. Injections are typically given weekly but can be more frequent to maintain stable levels.

Topicals: Creams and gels are applied daily. They’re less effective than injections and can be messy.

Pellets: Implanted under the skin and release testosterone over several months. They’re convenient but hard to adjust.

My Personal Experience

I started exploring testosterone optimization at 19, not because I needed it but out of curiosity and a desire to understand my body better.

My levels were within the normal range, but not optimal.

Through diet, supplements, and lifestyle changes, I managed to significantly increase my testosterone levels naturally.

Key Supplements and Lifestyle Changes

Zinc: Helps balance testosterone levels.

Vitamin D: Essential for hormone production.

Healthy Fats: Found in foods like eggs, help maintain hormone levels.

Regular Exercise: Particularly resistance training.

Before considering TRT, I always recommend trying to boost your testosterone levels naturally. This includes:

Diet: High in proteins and healthy fats.

Exercise: Regular strength training and cardio.

Supplements: Zinc, vitamin D, and herbal supplements like Ashwagandha and Fenugreek.

Sleep: Ensuring 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.

Stress Management: Practices like meditation and yoga can help reduce stress, which negatively impacts testosterone levels.

TRT can be beneficial for those who truly need it, but it’s not without risks and should never be the first line of treatment.

Always consider natural methods to boost your testosterone levels first.

If you do opt for TRT, ensure you’re working with a knowledgeable professional and are well-informed about the potential side effects and long-term commitments.

Remember, the goal is to achieve your health goals safely, efficiently, and effectively.

Disclaimer: This article is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice. Always consult your doctor before starting any treatment.

By following this guide, you’ll be better equipped to make informed decisions about TRT and testosterone health.

For more detailed insights and personal experiences, check out my other videos and articles. Stay healthy and informed!

Melanotan II Peptide & PT-141

Sex drive is primarily controlled by testosterone, in both men and women.

Viagra and Cialis are common treatments for erectile dysfunction, but they don’t work for about 35-40% of men due to low testosterone.

Ironically, they work better in younger men because they have higher testosterone.

However, there is another drug or solution for those that don’t respond and it works in 4x the people… it’s PT-141.

Let me briefly explain what it is and how it was developed.

Melanotan II Peptide was originally developed as a sunless tanning agent. It works by stimulating alpha-melanocyte receptors, which promote the formation of melanin in response to sun exposure.

You take about 1 mg a day and you’ll get tanner. If you add in a little bit of sunlight or a tanning bed, you’ll accelerate the process. It can literally make you almost black if you take enough of it. It can also darken moles.

Now, one of the side effects of this drug is erections. Far more powerful than Viagra and Cialis.

Of course, if you use it just for sexual reasons, you’ll be super dark.

PT-141 was discovered later as a derivate of Melanotan II.

Unlike Melanotan II, PT-141 enhances libido without the tanning effect.

It activates melanocortin receptors in the brain, boosting dopamine and oxytocin levels, which are essential for sexual arousal and bonding.

My Personal Experience

Years ago, I experimented with Melanotan II and PT-141.

The results were impressive – stronger erections and increased libido.

However, timing and dosage are critical. PT-141 takes about 4-6 hours to kick in, unlike the quicker action of Viagra.

My first experience was intense, with effects lasting several hours.

I recommend starting with a low dose to avoid side effects like nausea and prolonged erections.

Nasal Spray For Erections?

PT-141 can be administered via injection or nasal spray. While injections offer precise dosing, nasal sprays are convenient but may degrade faster.

Always consult your doctor before trying PT-141.

Maintaining optimal testosterone levels enhances PT-141’s effectiveness, allowing lower doses and reducing side effects.

PT-141 is a promising solution for enhancing libido and addressing erectile dysfunction, especially for those who don’t respond to traditional medications.

1 – Diet To Increase Testosterone

Your diet – what you eat AND don’t eat – is extremely important for controlling your hormones.

Your PROTEIN should come from natural sources, such as wild salmon, pastured whole eggs and grass-fed bison/buffalo are my favorites and most powerful “testosterone” boosting proteins.

2 – Exercise To Increase Testosterone

Exercise is extremely important.

Unfortunately, most people do too much or the wrong forms, which causes an increase in stress hormones and lowers testosterone.

You need to lift weights – do so 3-4x weekly or every other day.

Keep your workouts to less than an hour, including the warm-up.

As far as cardiovascular, the best is daily brisk walks for 20-30 min or you can do them on your “off” days. The worst is strenuous cardio such as running or similar intense activities.

Most people leave out this part of the equation.

When stress hormones go up, testosterone levels go down and so do other youthful hormones.

Stress is both physical and emotional.

title: ❓ High Blood Pressure Causes Erectile Dysfunction? ( 2025)
content:
If you’ve seen my previous articles, you know that hormonal imbalances are a primary cause of erectile dysfunction and a decrease in your libido and sex drive.

However, most people don’t realize that having high blood pressure ALSO causes erectile problems.

In fact, high blood pressure also causes a decrease in libido and loss of interest in sex for women as well!

This is important to know because, in 2025, 33% of Americans over the age of 20, have high blood pressure. And 90% have hypertension by age 65.

What’s even worse, 72% of people don’t even know they have high blood pressure.2

So statistically speaking, if you’re watching this video … you probably do NOT have “optimal” blood pressure levels.

And if you’re experiencing any form of erectile dysfunction … or a decrease in your libido …

Or you simply want to improve your “performance” in the bedroom, it’s extremely important that you support healthy blood pressure.

Hypertension & Physical Causes

Blood vessel damage from high blood pressure (HBP or hypertension) reduces blood flow throughout your body.

Lower blood flow to the pelvis can negatively affect the sex lives of both men and women.

Men – High Blood Pressure and Erectile Dysfunction

In a man, the effects of high blood pressure on sexual function are more physically apparent than they are in women. Erectile dysfunction happens when there’s not enough blood flow to the penis to allow for an erection.

Basically, a common cause of erectile dysfunction (impotence) is damage to the lining of the arteries to the penis. Because of this, there’s less blood getting to the penis and thus, you end up having a “limp dick”.

Blood pressure can damage your arteries by causing them to become thicker, or even to burst. This can restrict blood flow to your penis, which can cause impotence.

Women – High Blood Pressure, Loss of libido & Interest

Women with high blood pressure may have lower libido and less interest in sex, especially if the condition is contributing to fatigue.

If a woman’s blood flow to her vagina is reduced, it may also affect how her body responds both before and during intercourse.

Blood Pressure Drugs and Impotence

So if high blood pressure wasn’t bad enough for your sex life, the typical solutions are even worse!

Unfortunately, most doctors will simply prescribe blood pressure drugs, which are known to cause erectile dysfunction.

In fact, it’s estimated that over 70% of men who take blood pressure medications, decide to get off of them because of these negative side effects.

As I’ve stated in all of my videos, you do NOT need to take drugs to help fix your health challenges. Nature already has the solutions.

So whether you’re a man or woman and you want to improve your sex drive, and libido and help fix any erectile problems, make sure you optimize your hormones and support healthy blood pressure.

title: Erectile Dysfunction (ED) Defined - Real Causes & Solutions
content:
In today’s article, I’m going to discuss “ED”, which stands for erectile dysfunction. I’m doing this topic because I get a lot of questions about it

What’s the true definition?

What are the best solutions?

And the truth is, that if you’re a guy reading this article, I don’t want you to feel “alone” or “ashamed”. Trust me, this is a lot more common of a problem than most guys admit, especially in today’s modern life-style of

Bad foods and pollutants

Too much radiation from electronic devices.

All causing an imbalance in your hormones.

In fact, statistics show that 20% of men in their 20’s have ED, 40% of guys in their 40’s, 60% of men in their 60’s and so forth.

Erectile Dysfunction Defined

Erectile dysfunction, or ED, is the “inability to achieve or sustain an erection, suitable for sexual intercourse.”

This doesn’t mean you have to be completely “impotent”, where you can’t even get hard.

And this also includes times when you physically feel fine, you’re still horney, and you can get erections,… but something is happening in your BRAIN that causes you to “go limp”, either before or during intercourse.

Unfortunately, your penis has a mind of its own and there’s never one simple answer.

The truth is, “ED” problems are not just experienced by “older guys”. Young guys deal with it as well. It’s called “performance anxiety” because they’re thinking about it too much.

They don’t have enough experience or confidence or something else “emotionally” is happening, which causes the penis to not work like it *should* or in private when you’re masturbating and everything seems perfect!

If “ED” problems happen once in a while, then it’s not a big deal. It’s normal and it happens to all men at some point.

However, if it happens more often than you’d like, then this can be a “warning” sign of health problems.

What Causes Erectile Dysfunction?

So, there are a lot of reasons for erectile dysfunction.

As I said, your penis has a mind of its own and sometimes, it’s completely disconnected from your “big brain”.

There are “medical” causes, such as certain drugs — prescription, marijuana, alcohol, tobacco, stimulants (caffeine), etc. — This can affect any man, at any age because these drugs lower your testosterone and/or cause blood flow problems.

Then “physical” causes, such as poor blood flow, chronic illnesses, fatigue, wearing a condom, etc. — happen more to older guys.

There are also “emotional” causes, such as feeling insecure, lack of experience, worrying about stress, performance anxiety, problems with your partner, etc. — This can happen at any age. Stress is more for “older” guys, while anxiety is more for “younger” guys.

Finally, there are “hormonal” causes, such as low testosterone, high estrogen, prolactin, progesterone, and cortisol levels — This used to be more towards “older” guys, but these days it’s affecting younger guys as well, as early as their mid 20’s.

However, almost all the “causes” – whether physical or emotional – cause a NEGATIVE change in your hormones!

What Are The Solutions?

The solution has to be based on the PROBLEM.

Now, if the problem is emotional, then this is something you need to personally examine by having an adult conversation WITH YOURSELF!

If you’re feeling anxiety or low confidence or something similar, I guarantee that the person you’re with is also having similar thoughts and feelings. TRUST ME, we all have insecurities and women have even more than men.

Please STOP beating yourself up about it. Focus more on the other person. Give more to them. Use your mouth, tongue, and fingers. She’ll appreciate it very much and you’ll give your brain a break and let more blood flow to your penis.

Remember, even emotional issues such as anxiety or depression cause a NEGATIVE change in your hormones, which manifests in physical symptoms such as erectile dysfunction.

Stress and worry are NOT your friends and will lower your testosterone and decrease blood flow.
